column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's pretty great overall, but like it's always the same ad playing and gets really boring and is also very annoying. Not only that, but when I search podcasts, the words aren't always synced properly and there are some misspelled words. Plus I really dislike that they add songs to your playlist that u didn't add yourself. It gets really annoying when I want to listen to my own songs but the Spotify added songs keep playing

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: honestly this app is really good but theres some really annoying bugs. the first one is whenever i click to play a certain song it just starts playing something else. second is that i cannot off shuffle mode. i do not have spotify premium and whenever i try to off shuffle it just gives me the spotify premium sign. its so annoying please fix it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love this app so much, I have Spotify premium and the benefits are great. All the features are great. But the app itself could use some work, certain glitches or errors in certain features effect the listeners experience in a negative way. For example, the jam feature, where 2 or more people can listen from different devices at the same time, it's a great feature. It's a great way to feel connected through music. But whenever you add a song, or the host adds a song, the song glitches

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a great app, don't get me wrong. I just love putting on some headphones and finding some great songs to listen to, but there's one problem. When you try to play a song, it sometimes plays a completely different song, and it's so annoying. For example, I try to play lovely by Billie eilish, and it plays another love by Tom Oddel. I don't really like it, and therefore Spotify gets a 3 star review.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the app, great features. One seriously aggravating problem: if I don't turn on shuffle, I don't want it on shuffle. I don't think it should be assumed that people want something mixed or a single played song. That's how my Spotify opens every time and it's terrible. Other than that, it's a phenomenal app and I would still recommend it to people.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app was perfect beforehand, but now I can't go to a certain song in one of my Playlists, can't fast forward, can't skip. The app is now just a different version of Amazon music, though the app does have good music quality and many different options of songs. But I do hope for things to go back how they used to, and till then, I won't be using Spotify as much. It's such a bummer and disappointing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm not sure when the functionality of the free version changed, but Spotify free version is total rubbish now. 100s of favourite songs on my playlist (which I know are still available to listen to via the Desktop free version) are no longer played. Clicking on any of my playlisted songs, something random is played. Ditto when you search for a song. In addition, the songs timeline does not allow direct access to parts of a song (no drag'n'slide). The app is currently pointless.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify, there's just a couple of improvements I would like to see. Firstly, I would like to see an equaliser since some sounds, especially in podcasts are often too much for one's ears. Secondly, the radio playlists are based on what I hear, when Spotify can make such assumptions. However, most of the time I go to the radio to find new music. I would love to see an option where the music in radios are completely separated from my seemingly similar tastes.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is my main music app, and my most preferred, it gives me good suggestions and aligns with my mood quite well. it's a great music app overall, with amazing UI, nice features, and the most accurate Radios I've experienced through all the music apps I've tried. Aside from the features locked to premium, the lyrics are not a premium feature and doesn't even attempt to load the lyrics any further once it doesn't the first time. and it's annoying since it works when it wants to work.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Been using Spotify for a few months now and I love it. However, recently music has stopped playing randomly after I switch over to other apps that are not playing sound. I don't understand why Spotify is doing this. This is especially frustrating as I'm paying for premium in order to get an uninterrupted listening experience, but now I'm being interrupted by the music suddenly shutting off. Hope this issue gets fixed soon.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I use it for both music and podcasts and either way I hate the way the queue works. Or actually doesn't work . It took me ages to find the tab for it, which I stumbled in accidentally. And the way it so easily drops downloads! And I can't figure out why if I try to play an album it switches back to a podcast after one song! The solution was to clear my podcast queue. NO!!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm a huge fan of Spotify, but over the past two years, I've run into many problems constantly. The first few songs often refuse to play, regardless of whether I'm on Wi-Fi or Data. When a song starts, it frequently gets stuck at 10s, consistently happening across two different devices. (Not at same time) While there are times when everything works seamlessly, it's become a recurring problem. I've ruled out my internet connection as the issue. It's sad. I guess I have to find a new app üòî üòî üòî

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Love Spotify, and have for years. HOWEVER... my only beef is that while the app WILL technically run in the background, if the app is not front-and-center screen, it will randomly cut out and stop. I use my phone for Uber navigation, so Spotify cannot be the diva on screen, so it will constantly throw a hissy fit and stop if this is the case. Very annoying to have to constantly fiddle with my phone to re-open the app window and restart my music. Other than that, Spotify is the best music app!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Great if you have premium, if you don't, well at least it's not buggy. The adds are are too frequent and repetitive, at least give as variety with our adds. You can't listen to music offline and when you do play music it's on shuffle (personally I'm ok with this, but it's still a terrible decision). However, the absolute worst is when they play songs you either don't know or dislike, and only give you six skips an hour. It'd be better if I could actually listen to the songs I like. Uninstalling.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify. I use it almost every day and I have the premium account which I enjoy. But, I have been having issues with the podcasts. When I click my headphone button to resume where I left off, it hardly works. I go into the app, and like some reviews have said I get a black screen, and timestamp is sometimes 0:00 and the play button is unresponsive. I have to force quit the app. Very, very annoying. Also, the shuffle button for music SUCKS. May as well be called the "reorganize" button.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Way too many ads. There's almost always an ad after each song, its rare to have 2 songs in a row before an ad, it's gotten ridiculous. A year or so ago it wasn't like this and I could have a few songs play before an advertisement. It is much too saturated now. Literally YouTube music, the free version has 0 ads and unlimited skips. Only downside is it's harder to find new songs which are recommended to you on Spotify.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Best app to stream music that I've ever had/tried. Granted I pay for the premium, which allows me to be ad free and be able to create, edit, delete and merge playlists as I wish. I can listen to songs back and forth, skip as many times as I want, share with others and allow others to contribute to playlists. The only thing that is a bit "meh" is the DJ, because I've never had him play a single song that isn't already what I was listening to about 5-7x - barely and rarely gives anything new to me

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify and paying premium for about eight years now. The experience, however, only worsens. The app is bloated and sluggish on mobile. I have to fight device selection, smart shuffle and background requests to features I have no interest in like videos, lyrics and band info. This used to be a solid music player. Now it is an app that tries to do a dozen other things by compromising on the main functionality. I'm organizing myself to move away from this bloated mess.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Long time subscriber, but...Spotify is getting worse and worse. The app has barely changed at all in the at least 10 years I've been using it, but more and more bugs have come up, which don't seem to resolve. The latest one is Spotify doesn't report the right songs to my notification bar, or when connected to my car. I have to open the app to see the actual song it's on, otherwise it shows some old random song I played recently. I also can't control the song progress and other things

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Despite people saying it's borderline unusable for non-paying members, I caved and downloaded spotify a month ago to make listening to music easier. I didn't get why people were complaining because it was working great for me. But I clearly had some sort of free trial because today it really is just unusable. I can't play one song, only playlists. I can't choose the song on the playlist. I can't skip to the best part of a song with the time bar. I'm uninstalling the moment I finish writing this.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to be pretty good, not anymore. Picture going to the gym and starting your workout playlist. You get an ad saying 30 mins without ads. One song plays and then 3 ads in a row. Not to mention, during your 45 minute workout, not a single song from your playlist is played. They aren't even good songs to work out to. About to delete the app.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using family premium for months now and it's quite nice. Me and my friends get to download, share and listen to the same music at the same time. But unfortunately, my Spotify doesn't have background "animation" unlike other people i know. Their songs picture's animate and mine doesn't. i tried searching on the internet and it said i needed a app for that. Would be nice if premium users can get better access to things and fix the bugs .

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Took a break from the paid version, and the free version angered me to the point of no longer wanting anything to do with Spotify ever again. I am constantly bombarded with "this ad gives you 30 minutes of ad free listening" followed by ONE song, and then I'm hit with another ad. WTH? Oh and you can only skip songs 2-6 times? The fact I can't rewind/restart a song, or even select which song I want to listen to is a joke. I just use YouTube, it's a much more pleasant listening experience.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I like the app, however I noticed recently and especially today, that random songs are playing in my play list. I believe I listened to four songs from it and the rest of it were random songs that I didn't wanted to listen to. In the end I just closed the app because it became annoying. Please stop with this, it is frustrating and it's just plain annoying. Playlists are designed to listen to specific songs and not whatever your algorithm thinks I want.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has gotten worse and worse over time, and really kind of sucks now. I'll have a playlist going of rain and other sleep sounds, and it will just randomly stop. Half of the podcasts I've already listened to are not marked "played" so it's hard to find the episodes I haven't listened to yet. Also have a hard time frequently connecting in my car and to smart devices to listen. Really frustrating--especially when I'm paying for premium!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The service is amazing (for the consumer anyway) ... But constant, unnecessary updates mean the app is almost always in a state where one or more specific functions are not working. Currently, downloaded ablums do not load when in offline mode. I find this intensely annoying as I listen to albums more than playlists, and I am often in areas of poor internet so offline mode is necessary to play uninterrupted music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Music keeps randomly stopping since last update. This has been a constant problem since 2021. I've had two different phones from two different manufacturers during this time. Recently, it has become unbearable. I can play a song and when it completes the song and moves to the next the audio stops. The progress bar will continue just like it's playing but I get no sound. This happens in my car using Android auto and also when I use Bluetooth headphones. Please fix this or I will be cancelling

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app has been good on the free version for a good while, I've only had it about a year. But recently after like two songs there's ads for 2 minutes. I didn't mind the ads too much back then as they weren't as frequent but now it's just really annoying. Another problem I've had is that I will use all my skips for the hour but then the app won't give the skips back. the first time this happened I logged out of my account and that worked but it hasn't worked the 2nd time. Pls fix

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Android Auto Spotify is a mess. Playing a random song from a playlist and want to go straight to see all the artists available offerings? Can't do that. Want to go to the full album of the current playing song? Nope. Ok, so search the artist manually... only two albums out of 8 displayed, but not the one you want of course. What twit designed this and thought "yeah, good enough."

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Do not use this app for podcasts. It does all the standard stuff you'd want for music, plain and dry, but its podcast features are an absolute mess. More headache than its worth, especially with much better alternatives on the market. The podcasts on here break the app literally every time it's used, and the only fix is to force stop the app. Every time. Any time. If you pause the app once, because you had to do something quick, expect another force shut down. Simply don't get this for podcasts

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Quite often, even while writing this, the next song plays but without sound. I have to move the circle on the play line forwards and back for it to work. Skipping does not work. It happens maybe 4/10 songs. Tried different headphones. WiFi/home/downloaded content. All the same experience Update - I've spoken with customer service a few times, done the delete and reinstall a few times. I've tried the test version too. It still stops playing sound often. Now, it also stops playing

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know if this is only happening to me. But it's very difficult to download music offline. I have playlists, albums, songs, that have been loading for weeks, even months. They don't download to my phone. Only some songs will completely download while others are left loading endlessly. Which is very annoying as a frequent traveler, only being able to listen to a small percentage of my offline songs. I have checked to see if it's a storage issue, but I have more than enough space on my phone

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify used to be great. So great that I got the premium. With recent updates, the UI changed drastically, in my oppinion for the better. New features that were really cool and useful for people who liked to expand their tastes. But now, the app doesn't work half the time. It freezes constantly and lags so bad that I'm here writing this review to tell Spotify this: FIX THIS ASAP.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app does not seem to understand that I want to be able to listen to a whole album IN ORDER without the suggested songs popping up. I am sick of them adding stuff to my playlists that I never asked for. I can't even listen to the songs I want. It also won't let me listen to a specific songs when i go to a Playlist, it makes me shuffle it. And it always adds stuff to my playlists, which is annoying. The ads are understandable but you can can down with them a bit.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify Premium for almost "4 Years" that a very long time,I can say that, It was one of the best and my favourite music application. On the other hand they also added podcast but I never liked listening podcast in Spotify .But from last one year, I started experiencing bugs, lags ,crashes and also some unwanted recommendations, which is ruining my experience. And as they are trying to add more and more features ,user interface getting complicated and ruining user experience.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Terrible UI. Can't decide for myself what I want to see on the home screen, it's mostly huge tiles with suggestions I never asked for. There's a small list with bookmarked podcasts at the top, but for some reason some podcasts will simply not show up there, despite the app saying it has added them to the home screen. "Good choice" my hairy behind, Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It keeps playing songs that aren't in my playlist like recommended songs. I don't want that. It's very annoying because I'm in my zone listening to my favorite songs. And it plays some random song I've never heard before. I'm also not allowed to do anything without premium but listen to music that is decided by app. I want to be able to loop my music, go back, skip ahead and enjoy favorites. Not what's picked for me.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I only have Spotify as a subscription was bundled with my phone plan. The app is pathetic. I can't get the volume up beyond a whisper. Even when I dig through the app settings and manually set the audio to "loud" nothing changes. Youtube, for all it's faults, at least when you turn the volume up it'll actually get louder. Just worthless. I usually stick to using my MP3 player in the gym.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I pay monthly for this app, and honestly, I'm beginning to feel like a fool. Just 2 months ago, the app was great. I'd rate 5 stars. But now, I'm ready to cancel payments and delete the app. It's very frustrating that it forces closes constantly, and after each song, you have to close the app and reopen to search for a new song. Also,it won't stay connected Bluetooth, after a few songs it disconnects and you have close the app and restart Bluetooth to reconnect. I'll give it a week,then delete.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I Like Spotify a lot, i think it's a really good app to enjoy some music (even tho ads bothered me sometimes), but recently... i ran into some problems... the main issue is that some songs won't just show up any lyrics... and mind you... the songs i played showed lyrics and now it just disappeared, i try to restart over and over again but the problem is still there..... It's a really minor in-convenience and i hope this issue got fix as soon as possible....

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The app works well for the most part. The shuffle feature(s) tend to be repetitive depending on the song one starts with. Also, since the last patch,the app doesn't sync with my vehicles Bluetooth: always "there is no song info available" where before there had never been a problem. It's also bugging out on my phone and displaying incorrect information when I play anything: wrong song titles, artists etc.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Horrible, I USED to live using Spotify! Until they made it completely unusable for non-premium subscribers. They add their own songs to YOUR Playlist, the give you an ad every 2 songs (even though they said you get 30 mins of ad free) and you can listen to one specific song without getting a full 20 others before it! Worst of all, you only get 6 skips, and you can't go back to a previous song in your Playlist. This is the only music app that I can download on my device, and it's just annoying.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: dont get me wrong, this app is amazing. i love how you can now choose the songs to play just by clicking it, not having to wait for the playlist to play it for you. but, the ads have been too much lately. there is an ad almost after EVERY SINGLE SONG. i have been getting the instagram ad ONLY. not any other add, even the ones that say, "enjoy the next 30 minutes of un-interrupted listening." it sometimes even play the ad back to back more than 4 times. please settle down on the ads, spotifyüôè

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: There are long standing bugs in the most basic user flows, like connection to the Bluetooth devices, playback often not continuing after pausing and unpausing. Often the search inside the app stops working completely and the app needs to be restarted. Oh, and the most annoying bug: it takes Spotify like a minute to figure out that the device is not connected to network or that the network is not working to start playing a downloaded song or podcast. If it's downloaded, play it from downloads!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Terrible and glitchy. For some reason the song in the notification bar doesn't change, just shows the same song even though it's not playing. If you are listening to an album, stop listening, and resume later, it will play one song before stopping and going back to the first song, if you click play on the first song it will start playing random songs which aren't on the album. What is the point of paying when it's so bad

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: So I've had y'all for years and on premium, never any issues, loved it. Lately what's made me lose interest/get frustrated, is the fact the freaking Smart Shuffle randomly starts up and ruins my qued list and completely eliminates it. Music on queued I've learned is that you can't go back two songs or you lose the one you were listening to completely and the then list gets jumbled. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app. It doesn't fix it. Was it an update?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Paying for music is a bit overpriced, and even with premium it was still a bit glitchy: music keeps "lagging," sometimes cannot skip to any part of the song, and the downloaded music from artists shows me any songs of theirs instead of the ones i specifically want. Can't forget the "can't load lyrics" prompt, at times it feels really random but It's an alright app- when you've got the money for it. Unfortunately for me i won't be using it for now

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Huge catalog of music but...It's not often that I can't find something I'm looking for even some really obscure old school punk stuff. Tons of music. App works great on iPhone but is nearly a dumpster fire on Android. Constantly lags when going into my library. Songs will randomly skip. Add gaps between songs that are not on original album, ruining the flow of the songs. I feel like the recommended auto-play songs came from someone who has never listed to music. Might go back to Tidal.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: One of my work benefits is Spotify Premium, and I love it. Sometimes when a new song is playing there's no audio, all I have to do is skip and/or restart the song. I'm not sure if it's just a problem for premium users, I hope it is and not for non-premium users. That'd just be a waste of skips and I can see the non-premium users getting frustrated.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Offering books for premium and then having to purchase more time to listen to the rest is ridiculous. I'd rather pay Audible for credits to actually purchase the books. Other than that, I've enjoyed Spotify for over 10 years for music. 10/10. I just wish there was an option to select certain or all playlists and have them on random like you used to be able to do years ago on the iPods.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: UPDATE: the songs randomly stop or just don't play at all. Developers, fix your app. The company is already in hot water for how they're treating artists on the platform. Don't add fuel to the blazing dumpster fire. In the past three months, I've had to restart and reinstall your app 16 times. Yes, I've been counting. All because the songs will NOT PLAY THROUGH BEFORE SKIPPING AROUND. I'm a dance teacher, and I've been a loyal Spotify customer for a while now. Fix your damn app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The new widget is far too large and can't be shrunk. The 4√ó1 widget was perfect. Making the smallest one a 3√ó2 (which can be widened to 4√ó2) means it doesn't fit in my typical layout. It takes up more space and offers the same amount of controls. It's frankly moronic. Fix this absolute nonsense and bring back the 4√ó1 or at least let us shrink it back.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I listed out a ton of problems, but found out it's because I don't have premium (it didn't tell me). The app without it is completely unusable. I can't pick a specific song, fast forward or rewind, skip or go back a song, play songs on my own playlist, skip ads, or shuffle a playlist. Actually awful experience of repeatedly trying to replay a song and having it play something else. I didn't know I was on (or lost) a free trial until I found someone else in real life with the same experience.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I loved this app from the very start, but I'm getting really annoyed by the pop-ups when I open up the app. Sponsored content is an ad regardless of how you put it (it is NOT a suggestion, it is an AD!). I paid for premium to not get ads. Even if it's just one click to dismiss the message, it is still a barrier to the content I paid for. The fact that I cannot disable these pop-ups is inexcusable and a downgrade in user experience. For this reason I am leaving

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Love 98% of this app. Two things that really ruin this app are. 1: It doesn't tell me how many tracks you have downloaded in your library so many of times I download a few albums at a time to find none have downloaded and are just spinning until I go through and have to pick what to delete. 2: once you go into offline mode and then back the albums get stuck in downloading mode just spinning until you go through and manually stop them all then restart and wait one by one, so frustrating.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Latest update made it impossible to listen to podcasts while driving. It no longer pauses the podcast while the Google maps navigation voice talks. So I miss part of the show and have to rewind 15 seconds. I talked to support and they just said "that's a new feature." And "switch to using Waze" I'm very disappointed and may have to cancel my premium plan if this isn't fixed. Basically made it worthless for me as I listito podcasts while driving.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I use this for podcasts and it's really quite annoying to deal with. Sometimes it just completely disconnects from my earbuds out of the blue(no other app does this) and if I pause a podcast for like 5 minutes and come back to play it, 70-80% of the time it just doesn't play and the only way to fix it is to reset my entire phone. This happens to me and many of my friends.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Old spotify was much better. It's so hard to make playlists and arrange your music with the app if you don't have premium. I shouldn't have to get on my computer to do something the app used to do just fine. Also, I get 30 minutes of ad free listening, but I never get the full 30 minutes. It's usually a few songs then back to all the ads. About over it.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Love spotify. But I'm extremely sad that if i don't listen to an album for a while, they automatically take it off my profile... not sure how long the window is, but dude, if i liked that album a year ago and just happened to not listen to it for a while, i want to be able to go and dig for it later... and sometimes i have trouble remembering titles, but remember album art. I'd really love it if you changed this, I've lost a lot of good music and it's frustrating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has been my streaming preference for years now, but lately, it's been crashing while listening to music. I have to constantly open the app just to play my music again, only to have it start it all over or change the song completely. This hasn't happened in a while, but lately, it's all the time. This is before and after updating the app

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I hate that Spotify overrides all other apps. It even starts playing when I get a phone call. Every time I get in the car, it starts playing even after I close the app.ü´§Edit: Now, on top of these things, it plays songs I have blocked. You have one job Spotify! Now it started playing a playlist I had on last week in the middle of listening to a podcast.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I completely stopped using Spotify after they decided to remove basic features (like playing just the songs in a playlist) inorder to make their premium offering more attractive. That is not how you encourage someone to try out your subscription. It's digital extortion at its worst. And Guess what, it's been about 6 months since I stopped using it and the world hasn't come to an end. Well what do you know!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I feel like the app is pushing sparkly functions but not very helpful ones. I'd like my car view back to easily skip or pause songs with a huge button, for example. You can make it optional for people who drive a car with fancy media function. Or fix shuffle. Or show saved playlists on the first screen vs in a tab you need to look for. Those kinda things. Thanks!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm a spotify user for years now and I really love the app. One thing I would like you to improve is the experience while updating our own playlists. I find the desktop version much easier when it comes to reorganize the songs of my playlists in comparison to the mobile app and I often choose that option since it's more practical. I think adding the cover of the albums on the "edit playlist" display could be visually helpful to enhance the process. Thank you and nice job!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall solid experience, the algorithm is so good that on long car rides I can just pick one song and never have to open the app. But I personally have 1 major issue with the app. There is no gesture to minimize the player, I don't want to have to tap the arrow in the top left to minimize. It's too far, just let me swipe down. It's so tragic that everything else is solid about the app, but the few minutes I spend in it is so annoying without the swipe down gesture.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Pretty good and has compatibility with tons of other tools and apps just by virtue of popularity. Though theres some of quality of life issues I wish would get addressed, and it feels like each UI update has something mildly annoying to add. For instance I wish it didn't take 3 button presses to simply unlike a song. It would be nice to be able to pin folders within folders, and not automatically shuffle or loop albums saved in folders.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

It has been doing this for the last month or so. I have an android phone. I don't want to delete and reinstall the app because I have ove 300 songs downloaded.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

You can't shut it off if a playlist has over 150 songs. Enjoy hearing the same 15 songs multiple times everytime on a playlist of over 1,000 songs. I'm sad, I used to love this app but between the repetitive Automix and constantly pausing for no reason, I'm searching for better options.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Restarting the app 3 or 4 times to get music playing again sucks. Also, the shuffle is just a literal repeat, like why? üôÉ

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Can't listen to a whole album without it changing to a song from a completely different album. Have to pay for basic feature like shuffle/playing songs in order or skipping more than 5-6 time a day. Can barely play podcasts anymore, WHICH WAS THE MAIN REASON I GOT IT. What makes this worse is that youtube has all these "features". You can skip, easily make a playlist of anything, and PICK THE ORDER OF SONGS YOU WANT TO LISTEN TO. How is it better than the app specifically made for music?

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Have used it for the past 3-4 years, only really bad in the last 2. Keeps stopping the play of my music and playlists from my library, and playing the popular suggested songs without my consent. Often won't open playlists, the search, or the library and won't work even when restarting the app, so now I rarely use it. Music just randomly stops, sometimes due to the slightest change in data/WiFi connection but really annoying. Ads are every 2 songs but Would still rather use YouTube premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As a music streaming app, the streaming part is just bad. Even with a stable internet connection, my music is intermittent... its infuriating. More so, it seems to always think that the app is set to offline when it is not. The app worked fine before... what have you devs done to screw it up? Changed from 2 to 1 star. Now it won't even play downloaded songs properly.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've had premium for a long time and recently it has been awful. While using shuffle it uses the same set of songs in the same order. It recommends the same songs over and over again. It has so many glitches and bugs spotify is just not worth it anymore. This comes from someone who loved spotify, now I encourage everyone to look into different options because there are no improvements in sight :(

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I'd been using an older version of the app for months because it worked perfectly. It let me pick as many songs as I wanted, skip as many times as I wanted, and it ran smoothly. The other day, I wanted to change my profile photo and the button to change it just.. disappeared? And no matter what I did it wouldn't show up so I had no other option but to update to the latest version and honestly, I could've done with not changing my picture. Limited everything, trash interface, and much slower.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Getting worse. Attempting to change the duration of the sleep timer randomly disables it, so you can be jolted awake by the intro to the next podcast INSTEAD OF ACTUALLY SLEEPING. Search is dire - there's so much junk in there now, it's just a cluttered mess, and I loath the thing where where it auto plays every single random search result after your selection. The golden age of tech actually improving our lives seems to be well over. Can't even get a music player that is good.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love music therefore I also love Spotify... But recently my playlist ain't playing the songs in it, they always switch back to the playlist I listened before that. Additionally somehow my music stops to work for no reason and won't play again until I actually pause and then continue (that happened every now and then) already reinstalled the app a couple times, because that seems to be the only solution

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Used to love Spotify, but now the app is slow, glitchy, and often crashes or fails to play music anymore. Even with music I've downloaded, it will sit there and spin for 30s before anything loads (if I'm lucky). Often I have to tap on a song 4-5 times before anything playa. And on top of that, I'm so sick of audiobooks and podcasts and random junk being shoved in my face. Been a premium subscriber for 8 years, but I think it's time to move to Tidal.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: spotify is my favourite app for listening to music by far as I can download music easily and (somewhat) quickly for offline listening. please tell me why this app is slowly becoming more and more useless with every update, even though I pay ¬£11 a month for "premium" listening, my downloaded playlists still don't work offline half the time and I have to turn on my data to fix it, my music doesn't always play when it says it does so I have to repeatedly open and close the app to refresh it. fix it

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

All of a sudden, it no longer plays an entire podcast, will switch from a kids episode to a true crime podcast if I let it play similar content (on what planet?!) Constantly crashes when using other apps or games. Something awful happened to it this month and it breaks my heart.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

It would take years to migrate to anything else but I really don't see the ¬£10.99 as worth it. Premium definitely used to be, but now, it just doesn't feel it. Especially since you're limited to playback on one device at a time at that price. Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

To fix my Spotify, I had to clear the data on my Spotify. Please give me an idea why this is happening.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

When I try to open albums or artists they won't load even though some of the songs on them will be downloaded. Also takes forever to actually start playing songs half the time

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Had premium for a few years now, it's been ok until recently. The app takes ages to load, sometimes it doesn't even load I have to force close it several times for it to work this happens even if I have already been listening to the app it's open in the background but won't play, the 'recommended shuffle' turns its self on while listening to my playlist, I put shuffle on which it will do for a few songs then recommended shuffle switches itself on. It's made me look at alternatives to Spotify!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: My experience with this app used to be good, but not anymore. I don't wanna pay extra just to listen to a song without 5 adds playing. I know it is on me not to buy premium but I still expect to listen to a few songs before an add popping up.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Makes it near impossible to use in the car as I can never see which song is playing, it just displays the name of whatever the first song played was for the duration. Tried clearing cache, data and a full reinstall and the issue persists, so must have been caused by a recent update.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm not sure what is going on with Spotify right now, but after years and years of utilizing this app 9+ hours a day, I'm looking into other sources. It just doesn't work like it used to. I guess all good things come to an end eventually.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

It plays, it stops for a second (more or less than a second), continues playing, stops again, starts again. Super annoying. I always have to close and restart Spotify in order to fix it... but once I open another or the same app, it glitches again.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is getting desperate. Why are basic features, like playing a song you want to listen to or even just rewinding a song, to be paid for? But now, we only have "6 skips an hour", and I can't even tell if I'm listening to music with ads or the otherway round. Please work things out to the consumers and owner's convenience.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Just let me play my music and not listen to some others stuff.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is more than likely the biggest music app available, with millions of songs and artists. There are tons of ads, you can't choose what songs you want to listen to, and you can only listen to music on shuffle, which can be annoying. With premium, this is by far the best app out there, with unlimited choices.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

It's a pain to switch to another service but you can't just rely on the music library and pricing forever. Please fix!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

I may go back to my old streaming service because it just ruins the experience for me.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: TLDR; the app is slowly getting worse. Smart shuffle takes somewhere between 5-10 seconds to active and turn off. Resulting in me having to go back into the app, turn off smart shuffle again (because it failed to turn off when I turned it off before), and restart playback.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

The skip function breaks down on the player.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Missing the option to select which local folders should be accessible under Local Files. Tracks that are marked as "hidden" play anyways. And something the developers of a music app should know better - not everything is called a "song", song is a genre, not a "track" which is a more appropriate term in this case. There's all genres of music on Spotify, this should be reflected in how each number on an album is referred to.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

This is a Spotify issue, not a user issue. And yes, I have tried deleting and redownloading. Please do better, Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

At least that's what it seems like. I mostly hear the 100 most popular songs over and over on playlists with several hundred songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I will download songs.. lol.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Vastly inferior to the desktop version of the app. Some features from desktop are locked behind a Premium subscription on the mobile version, such as basic functionality like playing an album (sometimes it just plays suggested similar songs instead of songs from the album you pressed play on). Also, I have frequent issues where playlists just unexpectedly stop after a few songs, which doesn't make me want to subscribe.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: So tired of these ads. I don't mind ads but the frequency is getting crazy. Finally used Spotify in months because I was avoiding them, and I got an ad. That's fine, two ads and it played my song. 6 seconds in I pause it because something came up, but two minutes later I press play and got 5 more ads. Then several before the next song and again the next got 2. Eta: I'm not getting premium again after somehow using several gigs of data on a two hour drive by playing exclusively downloaded songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have spotify premium and most of the time I cannot get online with the app and search for music. The offline option is not on either. The app always has me offline and I never selected to go offline. Update. I added about 8 song to a running Playlist. When I started the Playlist on shuffle it only shuffled to the songs I added and not the other 30 on the list. The song that it did shuffle to that I didn't just add it wouldn't play. It would just stop. Super annoying.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Really unhappy with how treats online/offline. If I've got a downloaded playlist and my wi-fi isn't connected, in online mode it will stop between songs. Works fine in offline mode. If I'm in offline mode and I pick an online feature (eg DJ) it just spins. I can't even get to settings or the back button. I gave to stop the app. So I'm constantly going back and forth between online and offline modes, which takes a lot of strokes and scrolls. Also don't like how it handles podcasts.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: If you don't have Spotify Premium its horrible use Youtube instead. If you do have Premium, then its a great app to listen music to and has many options, lots of great quality of life features and integrations with your devices that it is nice to just quickly pop open whenever (or instantly continue what you were listening to before if you don't fully close the app) and listen to your favorite songs. Although you really have to get Premium for it to be any good.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

This is extremely frustrating because I can get 6 or more suggested songs in a row while trying to listen to the song(s) I want. On another note, when it says "have 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening", if I click on another song, it automatically cancels out, so half of the time, it doesn't work.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Don't get me wrong, I love Spotify, but sometimes I simply cannot use it. For example, I'll open one of my playlists and it won't even let me view the songs I have added. Yet, when I press play it plays songs I didn't even add. Also, specifically when this happens, ads. A bunch of ads. It explains how you can go 30 minutes ad free when I can't go 4 minutes.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Spotify has also made it so you can't listen to your songs in order, it forces the "smart shuffle". It's getting worse..

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I wouldn'thave even given one star but since there was not a option for that i would have to give one. Total trash!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

AI DJ is a feature with much potential but plays the same 30 odd songs, as well as a few new ones. Overall quality has plummeted.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

So thanks for the free three months, but the current plans don't suit my needs/represent value for money.

I'm using YouTube Music and it actually works) Edit : is it typical for you to blame your customers for your failures? Seems like it is...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've tried a few other music services and this android app is now probably the best of the bunch as far as stability. However, the music service is near the bottom. Worst of the bunch maybe. It's all due to the forced "made for you" feature. It just ends up playing the same handful of songs no matter where you go, it seems. The algorithms most likely just limits the royalties Spotify has to pay to artists while limiting the variety of songs and the possibility of discovering new music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The latest update is too buggy and android auto lists all my spotify playlists as "no items" after a long trial and error i just found out that the latest spotify "update" is the cause of this issue. Besides this the app has a tendency to randomly disconnect from the internet and stop playing music. There needs to be an immediate fix to both these issues, primarily the Android auto one because I do not want to look at my phone while driving.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The March update is terrible! The widget on my phone no longer updates and it doesn't connect properly to my car display screen. If I want my car to display the song name and artist I have to uninstall and reinstall the app each time I get in the car..?! I clear cache too but that only works for the first song, then the screen stays on the first song even when the audio moves on.. very frustrating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Having the same issues as Maxwell W. (below): "... l'm having a very difficult time getting the app to consistently and reliably play podcasts. Oftentimes when I go to play an episode it just loads a black Ui, the play button is unresponsive, with a timestamp reading of 0:00. I have to restart my entire phone in order to get it to finally play ..."

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As a massive user of the app, I am sick of it. For the last while, I have been unable to open any of my playlist offline even though I have downloaded them. And every time I open the search bar, it kicks me out the app. It keeps asking me to open settings to allow the songs to play in the background, yet I have done it, and it stops playing the song. I am sick of it, and I may as well use another app.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app lets you watch an ad and get 30 minutes of uninterrupted music and I just was able to watch two of them within a hour and both of them played 3 songs then went to an ad break. Technically it's not even 3 songs because I skipped one on the last one and after the 3rd song which is technically the 2nd song it went to an ad break. I paid attention to the time when the 30 minutes of ad free was supposed to start and end it started at 11:30 so it should have ended at 12 but it ended at 11:40.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I am getting frustrated with removal of allowing multiples of the same song in a playlist. I have playlists that I created where I want a song played more than once. I don't understand it at all. Also, they should have playlists that focus on song frequency because there are songs that are meant to be played more in a playlist and some songs where you just want to add variety. This is frustrating because my solution was adding multiple songs. Fix this please!!!!!!!!! It just makes it worse.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Good app but after the new update the control panel on mobile during background play freezes constantly, and no longer lets you go back or forward on your audio using the slider. This is on the premium version. Hope it gets fixed soon. Offline features are also not working as well as they were. Why update if youre just going to make everything worse???

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: App has gone downhill in the past few updates. Adding new songs to playlists is difficult and tends to cause the app to freeze up and crash. It is very difficult to navigate to different songs or playlists due to the app lagging. The offline feature doesn't work anymore and music I have downloaded can't be played. This was never an issue in the past.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a good app, runs smoothly in my opinion. I don't like how when they "make a playlist" for me, it's 1/3rd full of artists that I haven't even heard of, and then when I go into their stuff, not even their good stuff. And also, don't put on their "instrumental" playlists that they make, it's 1/3rd songs with full on lyrics.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It was good, but now it won't work. At all. Last time it kicked me out my account after months so I made a new one, it was good for a while now it won't let me play ANYTHING, and I have playlists, but Spotify got rid of that play? button so now I can't play any songs. But I 'can add songs onto my playlists' but spotify won't even show me the songs that are on there already. Nothing works anymore and I can't use it. It keeps saying that playing a song is a premium feature when obviously it isnt..

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has steadily declined over the last ~2.5 years. The worst is their AI shuffle, which overplays your favorite songs until you hate them or only ever plays the same 10 songs that you heard the first time you shuffled a playlist. This can't be turned off. Songs will randomly pause and claim they're still playing. The "download music" feature almost never works when I actually don't have service and need it. Every time I open the app, it says I don't have internet and spazzes out. Use Apple.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Since the update early March I've been having issues. For starters, the Spotify player says it's playing when in actuality it's not playing anything. The only ways u can fix this is to manually skip, half the time drops you with 6 ads. Or close out of the app entirely and reboot then get ads anyways. The 2nd problem is the most interiorating, it just stops on u. When u go to click play again it restarts ur song or crashes. For a multiplayer it use doesn't work while other apps are running. „É?`–¥¬¥

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: For me even making a playlist on the regular YouTube app is a better option over Spotify, without paying for premium you can only have 6 skips per hour, after a while you can't even tap on the song you want to play, it has a 30 second ad almost every song, everything is locked on shuffle and it adds random suggested songs to your playlists, and you can't rewind to earlier in the song, it also takes forever to load anything. Wouldn't recommend for people who don't want to pay

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: 1)Lyrics not loading at any point at all, having to fully uninstall the app and reinstall to remedy the problem, only for it to happen again, maybe a week or so later. 2)Podcasts not playing. I will click a podcast episode, and it will show 0:00 as both the current time and duration. I either have to update the app or uninstall and reinstall to fix it, only for it to happen again only DAYS later. This has been happening for months now. There are more problems, but I have only so many characters.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app works.... ok. The sound level difference between songs I own and what I have on Spotify is irritating and should really be fixed. I don't like changing the volume every time. Also fix your shuffle, just because I added a song to my playlist doesnt mean I want to listen to it constantly, I like variety and get sick of songs easily.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: i think spotify is okay, but I'll have to watch a 30 second ad to have 30 minutes free of ads, but if i change the playlist, it doesn't work. and I'll have ads every two songs, like 2-3 ads. after the first one, if i dont open my phone, it'll just be a while of silence before the next ad plays, which is annoying especially if im cleaning and cant grab my phone. this is why i never use spotify. i tried giving it a chance, but i cant with spotify anymore. I don't want to be forced to pay either.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Used to be good but now has absolutely no way to turn off shuffle. Have uninstalled and reinstalled. Does nothing. Continues to add their songs for me into my playlists. When trying to listen to a song it doesn't show me a list of my songs in my playlists so I have to search it up and then listen to it. Absolutely useless at the moment looking for better apps. Although it works fine on my laptop.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is straight up malware! It uses a MASSIVE amount of storage space, far more than accounted for by downloaded audio & video- 80 gigabytes in my case! And it shows a far lower amount of storage usage in the app- less than 2GB. In order to see the actual data usage & delete it, you have to use your system app settings. It also provides no way to store downloads on the SD card. It's a terrible and buggy app overall, but this egregious harm to my phone is the last straw. I'm deleting this

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is good, but THE ADs dude, and sometimes when I want to listen to music, for example, Sonic CD special stage, when I want to listen to that, it makes me listen to different music. When I want to listen to the invasion of Astro Monster, it doesn't play the correct one it just plays a remake. Also, it doesn't let me use my microphone. What if there is a song that has a long name that I can't spell and I have to use my microphone.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: listening to an audiobook while driving, it was going in chronological order the first few chapters, then all of the sudden, decided to skip around to a few chapters ahead. I can't find the shuffle on/off toggle to make the chapters go chronologically. why is shuffle even an option for chapters in audiobooks? something this simple should NOT be this difficult to find on the UI. Ridiculous. fire someone in development üôÑ...these kinds of oversights are too stupid to go unpunished

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Automatically stops or adds songs to my Playlist. I specifically select the option to NOT add music to my Playlist. The app is taking on a mind of its own and its extremely frustrating. I'll give a 5 star again once it's fixed but right now it's ruined the whole app. Edit: I see a lot of 1 star reviews after this update. Stop fixing what ain't broke...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: There is a persistent problem with this app on Samsung devices. It seems as though every few weeks it overrides my storage location and backsup/saves media to my phone's internal storage rather than my SD card. My SD card has plenty of space, but my phone's internal storage does not. Every time this happens, my phone slows down, and it becomes almost useless until I switch it back, which is a time-consuming process. Please fix this problem!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Hate the free Spotify but it's the only thing I have as I'm too poor for premium currently (I'm being serious too), and the ads SUCK. Can't even get the "targeted ads" or whatever right, I keep getting ads of things I hate and whenever I click the dislike button (or whatever it's called) it just gives me the ad more... Like thanks for the ad of stuff I hate instead of things relevant to me and don't make me want to uninstall the app for a different music app! (heavy sarcasm)

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is quite aggressive with "auto-open" and "auto-play" on many cars. It's a known issue in the community for many years now and programming teams refuses to address it. Because of this they get a low rating - they don't care about what their consumers keep asking for. The ability to turn off "auto-open" / "auto-play". The issue keeps getting worse over the past few years. After over two hours of their "tech support" nothing was fixed - problem is still here.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: New like system is dumb. The like system used to work, if you tap the heart, it added it to your liked songs. Now that is no longer the case. It is now been exchanged for a plus icon, the same icon that adds something to a created playlist. Now the only way that I have found to reliably see if a song is added to my liked list, is the have to do it for my status bar, not within the app. Why change it worked great before. Been a premium for many years. Now just to keep waiting for HiFi music

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: No, just no, I'm not going insane just to listen to my music with my phone off, this app isnt even a music app at this point, it's just 60% adds every song, we can't replay songs, we can't put songs on loop, there's more adds then last year, and we only have 6 skips, and I've gotten the same ad multiple time!! I'm surprised this is a 4 star app.. I'm only keeping this app because I can listen to music with my phone off.. Very disappointed!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Last update has had nothing but issues. Android Auto won't update vehicle screen with current song information, or cast song information via BT. Also the app crashes when switching from shuffle to non-shuffle. Also defaults to shuffle even when I don't select it. Very frustrating and dissapointing. Will update review when resolved. A good reason to keep auto updates off.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I already used other apps to see if the problem was with my cell phone and apparently it is with Spotify, the duration/progress bar of the song doesn't appear, it appears blank, and when apparently it is fixed nothing happens, it gets stuck in the same song even if I put another one

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Used to be awesome but the last couple of months is suddenly skipping to the next song by itself. I have done everything logged out and in clear cache restart but it keeps going. Please fix it it's really annoying and i don't know where else to report a bug. Shouldn't we have this option available (whoever pays at least) and also for your feedback?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify the service, I've been using it for music for years, and recently discovered some amazing podcasts induced in my subscription which I'm enjoying every day. I wish I could rate the app higher, but it's not without its problems. The Artist radios and playlists used to be great for music discovery, but recently push 'Made for You' content which plays the same few artists over and over. How about adding a 'Discovery' option for helping to push lesser known music?

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is usually brilliant. Recently it has started to play up. The player will randomly pause whatever you're listening to, while still displaying a "pause" button, indicating that the player believes is it playing. You have to pause, then play again. In the grand scheme of things it's not a huge issue, but can be very annoying when working with both hands. Device is a Pixel 5.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I will never pay for a subscription to Spotify as it has lost any respect I might have had for it as it plays 3 ads after 1 or 2 songs without a subscription, possibly to push subscriptions to the app. I have watched as the "30 minutes of ad free music after this ad" banner shows up on an ad, only for the app to give me 3 ads after 1 or 2 songs. The only reason I continue to use Spotify is because I have not had the time to vet other music apps.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Can't listen to a specific part of a song, can't put songs in queue nor can off the shuffle and also cant play the previous song and also that it counts skips? Like 6 skips an hour? Are you serious? Spotify was better before. It's just annoying now.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I used to love this app, but lately it's become nearly impossible to use. It takes forever to load, if it loads at all; randomly pauses music when playing in the background; crashes all the time lately; and NEVER LOADS. I've been using spotify for 10+ years, and never have I been more disappointed with it than I am now. I'm paying for premium, yet I can't even use the app anymore. Honestly, I'm considering going back to pandora or YouTube music. At least those apps actually play music.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I've force stopped spotify, swiped away the player, uninstalled the app, and restarted my phone but nothing works. Please fix this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Btw you can use an mp3 app (depending on the brand of phone you have, it will be different) and a YouTube to mp3 transfer site to have all those songs for free.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

So that's all my complaints abt this app

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I would have purchased the premium but since the app is so annoying, I'd rather delete it.

Now I have to click every, single, song to see if I listened to it or not. Also, be nicer to non-premium users

At the moment it's incredibly frustrating as my phone wants to lock every 2 mins unless I press the screen. This is a relatively new but very very bothersome problem.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

JUST LET ME PLAY WHAT I WANT.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is slowly getting worse. Smart shuffle sucks and its a pain to get shuffle to turn completely off. It recently has had a lot of trouble loading in general on top of the new features.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Took 5 minutes for another ad to pop up.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Since the update, Spotify now states all playlists are empty when on the free version. I tried uninstalling, reinstalling and then updating. The free version is now essentially useless and you'll have to fork out for premium or go back to YouTube. Disappointed.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is total garbage for listening to podcasts. There's no option on the app for an entire list of just songs of an artist- you have to go in and out of albums; sometimes an album won't even be listed on an artist's page - you have to search for it directly. That's just a FEW issues & SUPER glitchy lately.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Auto plays randomly with a BT connected. This has been a long-standing issue. I'll be on a phone call and when the call disconnects Spotify automatically plays. Even though I was not using the app. There's a bunch of proposed fixes online but none of them work. I switched to Amazon music years ago because of this. *** Update***I will not contact customer support. Problem is plastered all over the Spotify community page. Generic response is laughable. Either fix it or own it! Amazon MUSIC FTW!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Feels scummy.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: I upgraded to premium and haven't regretted it! I download pkaylists for road trips and never worry about reception or finding a station. I've canceled x-fm and play what I like. I listen to podcasts to help learn a language, and listen to audiobooks almost daily. I had a problem with skipping. An internet search showed me that this is a common problem. I found a solution that didn't work. Eventually, I realized that it only happens with one Bluetooth speaker. I hope that helps someone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium still puts unwanted songs in my Playlist. I am constantly pressing the no bottom on songs that Spotify just THROWS into my Playlist! I have PREMIUM. I tried all of the instructions given online through the app. NOTHING works! I've had it for years and it just started a couple of months ago. I listen everyday while getting ready for work. It's Annoying to have to go back to my phone to skip an unwanted song they've added.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Good but not great app. Issues: Navigation confusing. Hitting back button doesn't bring you to album you're listening to as it should. When you use menu to go to album it doesn't have current song highlighted, which is idiotic. Hitting back button can unexpectedly exit app. I have it set to continue playing music after album or playlist is finished but it never does so. Daily Mix never updates.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The functionality of this app is now terrible. Stops playing in the middle of a song for no reason constantly. Whenever I'm in the car, in the shower, etc. Currently doesn't work when connected to Android auto, and the shuffle keys are confusing and rarely work. Very disappointing I will be canceling my subscription and going for something more user friendly that actually works reliably

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently have started having issues with the music player widget on the lock screen and notification panel - Galaxy S21 Ultra on One UI 6.0. Sometimes does not update the current track that's playing, sometimes it does update the track that's playing, but the track time/scrubber is missing. Also not showing track information when using Bluetooth audio on car stereo, and is causing issues on Android Auto where there is no track information displayed or play/pause/skip buttons. Can you please fix.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify for the past couple of years, and, generally, I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good music streaming service... if you're willing to pay for Premium. Otherwise, the app is pretty limited in what you can do. Copious amounts of ads, and it doesn't give you the choice to listen to a specific song in a Playlist (you just have to shuffle and pray). If you're a hard-core music fan however, I would definitely say Premium is worth it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Pros: Huge library. Cons: New features are overly intrusive. No high definition audio. Getting expensive. Everything else is car (Android Auto) related... Difficult to navigate relative to the app. Subscribed podcasts never show in home, only library, and you cannot go to your library without opening the full app (in car mode). Auto plays when connected to a device (there used to be a way to turn this off?). When it does autoplay it's often not what you were last listening too.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: App recently broke in March 2024. I updated the app since liked songs from smart shuffle enabled doesn't add the song to the "liked songs" default list. The + button would never change to a heart and the song would never populate in playlist. After updating today, pressing shuffle button a couple times does not enable smart shuffle anymore. Only regular shuffle is available and I'm premium sub. App is super unstable and inconsistent now. Disappointing and inconvenient. Lost a lot of songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm tired of the pop-ups when I log into the application. I pay money to avoid commercials and advertisements, obviously. If I do not receive an option to disable these, especially considering they're always completely off base, I will look for a different service. Happy to adjust my review If there is an option to disable these obnoxious things, but otherwise this service is going to be short-lived.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

And then when I go to start the song again, it starts from the very beginning when I just wanted to finish it where it was.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
