column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is becoming terrible. You try to add songs into a playlist only for it to crash... for some reason, when you add some to a playlist, they only show the clean version of the song instead of the explicit version even after going into your settings and allowing explicit songs, really frustrating when you're making a big plays list and you're fighting the app the whole way through it......its like watching a DVD and the movie keeps skipping cause of all the scratches on it...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Not sure who signed off on the new interface but the homepage is useless now. One BIG card for each playlist covering the entire screen removes the usability of the homepage completely. It's hard to read, the user gains zero additional information about the playlist. Im not scrolling TikTok I'm trying to find music to listen to. I have no reason to see the canvas of a song before I even open the playlist. Information density is no more. The old one was at least useable.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Until recently the app worked great, I use it offline to listen to music as I don't have much data, but recently randomly a lot of songs are unable to download even though I previously had them downloaded. I have tried everything I can think of and looked for solutions online including on your support pages but I couldn't find much there to help at all with the issue.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I prefer Spotify over Pandora. However, the past month or longer it will randomly cut out. The player shows as still playing when this happens and even when I hit pause and then play again it usually still doesn't start until I go to the app screen itself, or open the app back up and hit pause/play. Very annoying! It happens so often I'm using other apps. Reinstall did not help. Contact support just says sorry, check back for updates later as it's an ongoing issue with Android.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: FREE PLAN REVIEW! This is the worst place to listen to music. Maybe right after normal radio stations. If you think that YT is bad when it comes to ads, don't even try Spotify Free. 2 songs 4 ads, no option to actually choose what you listen to, only more or less artist. Limited skipping, no option to go back or "reset" the playlist that app prepared for you, so forget about listening to your fav song more than once and when you want. List goes on. Paid also starts to force ads in some podcasts.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Has gone from being fairly reliable to being utterly useless. Constantly freezes, stops playing, there is a constant error message stating I have no internet connection even when every other app and function on my phone works perfectly well. I've tried downloading songs and podcasts, but when I try to play those I just get a constant loading screen. I've tried resetting, uninstalling and reinstalling. Nothing works. Will not be paying a subscription for a broken app for a second longer.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: What has happened to Spotify? If I pay for premium, then I expect premium quality. There has been this super annoying echoing no matter what I'm listening to. This is terrible sound quality and is only happening Spotify, not other apps. I want to hear instrumentation not weird echoes that distort the sound. Are musicians/music engineers working behind this app at all? Edit: Stop ignoring issues. Of course I thought to uninstall/reinstall. That doesn't fix the terrible audio quality for Premium!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a really nice music app, I would definitely recommend it for music lovers. In the settings you can enhance the parts of your songs you want to hear like base, voice, or the instruments 8/24/21 3/10/24: -1 Star. The lyrics for almost every single song doesnt load anymore. The app quality overall had deteriorated since my last rating. Get the lyrics fixed please.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: 3/15/24 Once again, Release Radar didn't update this week. Last time this happened, I contacted support. They were not able to troubleshoot or resolve the issue. Even though I have almost 2000 liked songs, it plays the same hundred or so when on shuffle. I want a shuffle option where songs are not repeated until all songs have been played. I like the idea of smart shuffle, but unfortunately, it seems to just recycle songs I previously liked but removed from liked songs. So it's not useful.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Once the free premium ended, I couldn't loop songs, anytime I clicked a song it would take me to Internets Greatest Hits, and I couldn't play songs in playlists until the first one ended, and every two minutes an unskippable ad would pop up. And then premium is like 19.99$ a month. As a teen who can't focus without music this makes it even harder to focus, making it a waste of mb. Uninstalled after I only got 1 day of free premium because of how stupid it is.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: without premium I listened to 3 minutes worth of ads (yes i counted) before being able to listen to one song, if I accidentally skipped I have to sit through another 3 minutes of ads. I don't know if it is a bug on my end but it happens everytime on the phone app before i have to force myself to listen on the spotify web browser (which is laggy but the ads are roughly 20 seconds for each song instead of 3 minutes.)

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I really love this app although I'm disappointed that all of a sudden after listening to an album/playlist, it starts to play it from the beginning again rather than just continuing on with recommended songs from that genre. Playing your album/playlist random mode doesn't always give you a good mix of songs. 53hrs of music in my playlist and I've listened to the the whole Queen album within the first 2 hours. I've uninstalled & reinstalled the app and it's even had an update and still no change.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app has one problem. It's beyond frustrating, and the devs REFUSE to fix it. If you have bluetooth connected and open spotify, it will start playing automatically. This would take 10 minutes for the devs to fix. They just won't. I've been to so many threads to find a fix. There isn't one. MANY people are frustrated with this. Do better Spotify.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Works fine for most things but some basic options omitted. Like it will show things on the app home screen regardless of your wishes, for example I have certain albums and artists set to do not listen and every form of blocking allowed on the app yet it still shows them on my app home. Making it easy to accidentally click on it. When asked about this support just say put a request on the forums. Or basically the blowoff. Whats worse is the stuff still plays your blocked content.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify regularly since 2017. I have 300 Playlists. Unfortunately, spotify fascistically decided that every user must use their new feature 'smart shuffle' which constantly turns on by default for every playlist every time you reopen the app, and takes 5 full seconds of loading to turn off. Every. Single. Time. you open a playlist. I have never used this feature. I never will use this feature. Spotify provides no way to turn it off permanently. I will be canceling membership.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I pay for premium to not see ads and yet the first thing I see when I open the app is ads for podcasts even though I've literally never listened to one. Also the shuffle algorithm needs to be completely reworked. Edit: latest fresh hell is even if the app is in offline mode it won't show album / playlist details because it's clearly sending a request and waiting for the answer. if(){} else{}, it's not that hard guys

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Got updated for the prices' increase, so I'm waiting for actual improvements, not just a curly line VS a straight line to indicate a song is playing. I see updates, but not actual improvements. Still the same issue, when I choose a song to listen to and it's not with shuffle option, the music will stop after that song. If I pick the next in line, it'll start playing but with the shuffle option. Make it work.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: These developers do not care. And why does it consistently want to play music I skip consistently? Just because I "liked" it doesn't mean I want it on heavy rotation! I said it before, and I'll say it again: this app need a feature similar to what Pandora has where they "put it on the shelf for a while." When will spotify fix its algorithms and stop shuffling the same 1 or 2 hrs of music in a playlist that I skip when the said playlist is 11 hrs long? Fix this issue!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify, your app was close to perfect but now with the ads and constant premium promos it's just downright annoying, but that's not why I'm writing this review, I made this account 3 plus years ago when I was like maybe 9 and obviously I don't have that email anymore, and I have a new phone which I was able to log into spotify with because of cloud data, but when I go to change my email it just says, "something went wrong try again!" Over and over fix it or tell me how to.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I've used Spotify premium ever since the initial release, it's my favorite music app, and I've rarely experienced issues until recently. everytime I try to play anything, even downloaded songs, at some point the audio will just stop and the app behaves as tho I closed it. I'll lose my queue and it seems any podcast episodes I added to my library before the crash won't be there anymore. In the car the music constantly stops and won't restart, but Android Auto may be the issue there.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I love spotify but the most recent update broke the app. For some reason it will not show the correct title of the song thats currently playing on the lock screen nor in android auto or via bluetooth. It will also randomly stop playing whatever song Im listening to and switch to a different playlist. I really wish they would just revert the changes while they look for a fix but alas they wont

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Music randomly stops when I have it in background or playing through my Echo(s) and I have to go into the app so it restarts. Many times the music or sound will cut out or becomes distorted for a few seconds then it's fine for a bit and then does it again. Also, when it's in background and I go back into the app, it tells me that it has no internet connection and will not respond for several seconds and then it's fine. This happens regardless of whether I'm on Wi-Fi or data. Very frustrating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Lately I don't get what I pay for. Meaning, I pay 10.99 a month for a premium subscription. I should be able to listen to my DOWNLOADED playlists offline, but in the last few months, this hasn't been the case. If I don't open the app while connected to the internet, they just don't load. 2 stars only because it at least has the music I want to listen to, otherwise just frustrating. I should not need to write this for Spotify to know that there's something wrong! It's been MONTHS of this! Fix it!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently upgraded from an s9 to an a54. It as though spotify thinks my phone got 15 years older with how bad the app runs on a brand new phone. App takes a few minutes to load anything besides a black screen then takes an unacceptable amount of time to load playlists, skip songs, change settings, you name it. If thus remains unfixed I'll switch services.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently upgraded from an s9 to an a54. It as though spotify thinks my phone got 15 years older with how bad the app runs on a brand new phone. App takes a few minutes to load anything besides a black screen then takes an unacceptable amount of time to load playlists, skip songs, change settings, you name it. If thus remains unfixed I'll switch services.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app sucks so much! I don't mind about the ads, but I am so annoyed that I can't play the song I want to play or loop a track. It's horrible, and they're forcing you to pay for premium. Additionally, I'm annoyed that you can't go back a song so a song that you accidentally skipped cannot be played again. Spotify does poorly in encouraging people to pay for the app, instead forcing them because the free version of the app is so terrible.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Quality. This is the best... but I'm obviously paying for it. A month ago I decide to go free plan because I wanted to test the free side. Worst decision of my life. There's this new mix-shuffle this for the free users. Here's what's what. I make a play lists of 10 songs, I click play, it plays about 2 or 3 songs that are in that Playlist after that it plays 10-20 songs that aren't in that Playlist. (Songs new to you) the ads are longer than the songs but I rating the Premium side a 5star

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Too many bugs! The app frequently refuses to load new episodes of my podcasts, even days after they're uploaded. It won't add my favorites to the "my shows" area, instead hanging onto one podcast I listened to one episode of two months ago. When picking an episode to listen to, it takes up to 2 minutes to load, then continues stuttering and buffering throughout the episode. Scrolling up & down does nothing. Finally, it frequently and randomly crashes. It's just too broken and a bad experience.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Edit * I contacted their support people and they guided me through fixing the problem on all my devices. Putting my rating up. 4 stars for now I signed up because Google Music was ending and Spotify appeared to be a well supported platform. The music libraries seem to be similar but the app randomly drops out and quits. I'll have full bars on my phone, and it will just quit. Also, songs are randomly dropped out of my playlist and on shuffle it repeats the same group of songs.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a good streaming platform for music, but I feel like spotify is getting more and more greedy. It limits the songs you can choose on your playlist, and also stops you from ordering your playlist ever since the last few updates. It also gives you song ads to discover ogher artists in your own playlist. It's a really great app though.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm a Premium user & for years,I've used Spotify on my Bose Soundtouch speakers without any problems,until about a couple of weeks ago.Now,Spotify will play for a little while,and then just keeps randomly stopping.This is getting very irritating.If it doesn't get fixed soon,I will cancel my subscription and move on to Deezer,which is working fine.Please don't tell me to contact Spotify's customer support,as I've already done so,it was a waste of time,they weren't able to help at all. Please Fix!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify treats the users who don't pay for Spotify premium like garbage, first of all the "similar to the playlist you chose", at first it works like intended, recommending a new song a new song every now and then, but after a while it enters a chain of those songs and it won't go back to your playlist even if you play a song from your playlist, also 6 skips per hour? Did you even think before adding this? It's absolutely disgusting, you're slowly turning the app unusable, I hope it can be fixed

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This all was working fine for me until recently. When playing music in my car, instead of what's currently playing, it shows the name of the first song that got played in the session. I don't know what this update was about but its messed the app completely. Even when my phones not connected to anything, it's displaying that I'm listening to Elton John when Marty Robbins is playing. From recent reviews on here, I'm not the only person with this problem.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know why but whenever I get online again and open this app it always shows that there's no data connection even if the data is on?!! Like what is this? And I can't even search any songs to add to my playlist! It's bad enough that I can't listen to the songs as a like (skipping forward, playing the songs in whichever sequence i like and adding songs to queue.) The service is getting worse and worse everyday. I would have given 0 stars had I been able to!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: My premium just got expired, and I notice it just now that how messed-up they have made this app for non-premium users. The most basic and important feature 'Autoplay' is totally totally nonsense with forced spotify recommendations in a personal playlist, I mean playing the advertisements is not enough for you that you make people listen the songs they don't want to! Never buying Spotify Premium until you fix some important things for the free users :)

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: If I pay a monthly fee for this app, I expect it to consistently work. Almost every day the app freezes and turns darker and won't let me click on anything so I can't play music. I have to close the app and re open it several times just to maybe get it to work. If I can get it to work it takes about 10 minutes worth of trying. It doesn't happen all day but at least one occurrence every few days.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't realy know why, if this was an update, or somehow I got access to premium (even though it said I didn't) but I installed the app, and for 3 weeks I got to enjoy the ability to control playing a specific song, stoping, fast forwarding, skipping, and being able to play my Playlist. Then, one day, that immediately stopped. I can't play a singular song without it playing something else, nor fast-forward. It's now so restricted on a free plan, and I advise the team to reconsider the update.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You get an ad after every song or two now and they changed the 30 minutes ad free to 10 minutes. They dont even have the 10 minutes ad free pop up for every ad too, it only happens sometimes while most of the time its a normal ad. Also when you look up a specific song and it even tells you its just a "song" itll select the whole album and you may need to use your skips (if you don't get lucky), sometimes all of them to listen to the specific song you looked up.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have a giant Playlist and there's some days I wanna listen to specific songs without having to go in and out of different Playlist. They took the heart away and apparently there's a plus sign but I don't see either of these. So now I can't even like a song. I can only see hearted songs on my pc. I've cleared the cache and Uninstalled and it won't work. When Im at work,I can't be spending a lot of time going through different Playlist just to find a song I'm really addicted to at that moment.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's been really slow lately to the point I can't even use it because the front page won't load Update: I did reinstalled the app and the same problem persists, when I open the initial page will be just the loading icon and nothing more, I can't access my Playlist from the landing page and any other feature takes so long to load that I even close the app. Thinking about canceling my plan

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I used to love Spotify so much

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Not easy to upload mp3s not available on Spotify. I have been trying for weeks, you have to do it on a pc/laptop which I have, and followed all the steps I have found online (as this seems a common problem) but I can see the songs on my Android but they won't play. This is especially frustrating as I have over 200 songs on mp3 not available on Spotify. It is also super annoying that I can hide a song I don't like on the app, but they still play on Alexa. Also can't search songs in my playlists.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Update for Android really needs to be reviewed before publishing.If I put my music to shuffle, shuffle. If I put my music to not shuffle, don't shuffle.Remove those buttons if it's not going to work the correct way. It's really annoying that I have to close the app and reopen it every so often because it completely stops when I tell it to shuffle and not to shuffle or it decides to just stay on smart shuffle. I DONT WANT TO SMART SHUFFLE. Also, the widget size.Why change it? Spot premium btw

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Every time I bluetooth with any vehicle Spotify likes to take over. If I open the app, it automatically plays whatever I was last playing. Even if I pause and open my phone, if the app is the first thing on screen, Spotify immediately takes over and starts playing again. Has done this with almost every Spotify update. Nothing changes.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify Premium for a long time. Recently, when I pick any of my playlists, even on shuffle, it plays the same songs in the same order. Shuffle used to randomize the songs and turning shuffle off played songs in order. What happened? Also, not a fan of adding "smart list" songs. It's my playlist, I pay for premium, leave it alone. I can pick random if I want.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify for a while now and I like everything about the app but lately I realized that the short videos that usually plays when a song comes up is no longer there, I tried pressing the canvas option in the settings but it wasn't working, I tried logging in and logging out and didn't work, I tried reinstalling it again but it was still the same, please if you can help fix the issue I'll be very happy. The issue has been fixed, thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: this has been making me so mad lately. it doesnt let you play one song alone and repeat it, when you want a specific song you only get a playlist, but whats that? you wanna skip to get to the song? too bad you only get 6 skips every hour. its very annoying. it used to not do this but i just woke up to it. im switching to soundcloud until this is fixed, geez.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: ever since I got the app, I was able to listen to any song I wanted and the entire song. BUT now I can't listen to the song I want and I can only listen to 5-10 second part of the song when I press on it. HORRIBLE APP. and I'm NOT paying for premium, only 6 skips? how unfair. as the "number one music app", you SHOULD do better than this stupidity.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app autoplays songs when connected to any Bluetooth device like car. Will start autoplaying repeatedly despite stopping the music. It doesn't even have a feature to stop autoplaying. We will have to disconnect from Bluetooth device if we don't want to listen to music. And there's no feedback option in the app so that the problem can be updated to the app creators.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This is a decent music streaming app, but it's quite awful when it comes to ads. I understand the push to having people pay for the premium version of Spotify, but at the same time, I'm getting 4-5 ads after almost EVERY SINGLE song! Even when it tells me I get "thirty minutes of ad-free listening.", I get an ad after one song! Other than the problem I seem to have with so many ads, I don't see much else wrong with this app. It's a great source for music listening.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: You *have* to pay for Premium in order to use the app. Can't skip songs and can't listen to them in order, among other things, which should be basic features considering you have ads playing in between your songs. Jam is a great addition but it's sloppy, constantly pauses while listening long-distance. Mostly sticking to it because of convenience but it could improve in a lot of ways. Some things were overdone over the years, which is a shame.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It has been over a month I made first complaints, still my Spotify app can't be used on my phone without wifi, my mobile data is working well but I can't use it with the app. Every month, I make subscription without making use of it. I think I will just disengage with the app usage. I have made several complaints but the backend engineers or developers haven't done anything. Since January, I've been subscribing, while I can barely use the app, only with wifi. I'll deactivate my subscription.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify WAS such a great music app. But now, it's just gotten worse. One cannot listen specific parts of songs, one cannot repeat a song, cannot add songs to queue, that smart shuffle thing is the worst one can't listen a particular playlist/album it will add other songs, and most of the songs don't show lyrics.Everything is premiumüòë. I won't take premium for such reasons! Plus the problem is you cannot stream properly on other music platforms for a average fan.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Look, I like Spotify. Maybe the sound quality could be better, and maybe it would be nice if they had a more robust catalog- but it serves it's purpose, especially with Premium. However, I reached out to support regarding an issue with the offline download feature because my playlists were not being fully downloaded. I was jerked around by three different agents and told to make a new account, and then told I'll have to pay premium again just to see if this solved my problem. Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The PREMIUM version is quite good, with only a couple setbacks. The first is not having 'true shuffle' for playlists that contain 150+ songs. Spotify says that they put this option up for a vote, which is bizarre considering no one would've voted for 'smart shuffle.' The second setback happens when casting spotify to my home theater system. Random tracks will be missing audio, tracks are skipped without being controlled, etc. Discover Weekly and Spotify Radio are worth the pricetag.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have to say, this is a great app. I've never had premium before, and I don't think it's necessary for full use of the app, but there is one issue that I find really annoying. When I create a playlist and add songs, the app also adds random songs, and they don't always match the mood of the playlist. This is very frustrating, and as a result, I don't use the app as much as I could otherwise.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The music sounds good, creating your list is easy. My only gripe is that when I drive, I out it in my phone holder and it doesn't rotate to landscape mode, also, if I get a phone call, when I answer, I lose my navigation. The map turns off and the phone app stays on. Only happens with this app. Pandora used to let me keep nab on top. So If I don't know where im going, I can't answer my phone otherwise I can't see where I'm going. Wish they would fix these two things. Waiting on an update

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I miss clicked on log out, and it won't let me log back in even though the password and email are correct, but it says "the combinationos incorrect." This is a music app. We shouldn't have to pay subscriptions or "take breaks" from listening to it. The prices for the subscriptions are ludicrous! $17 for one person! Most likely, it's just another money-making scam.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Used this for a month without issues, and almost as soon as the month ended, ad galore. Almost anything, behind premium. Want the ads gone? Watch another for them to be gone for a little bit.. like I want to wake up at 5 AM to watch an ad so I can listen to music in peace. Clicking on SPECIFIC SONGS doesn't even give me the actual song, it gives me songs the stupid app thinks I may like. I shouldn't have to find a different app just so I can listen to music without hearing about products.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I dont have a positive view of this app anymore. It gives the 30 minutes of no ads, however after 10-20 minutes (about 3-6 songs) ads will play. Not just 1 either, usually 3 in a row. On top of that, at random points the app will freeze and close, songs randomly mute and when they end the app closes. As well as the fact on MULTIPLE occassions i have gotten 10+ ads in a ROW. Sometimes between songs, sometimes attatched to the "30 min ad free" offer. What is going on with y'all????

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The fact that you can't toggle the option for the app to auto play music when you open it is ad ware level of annoying. Everytime I open it, the last song just starts up. 9 out of 10 times that's the opposite of what I want and I don't understand why they would force that in the app. Insanely annoying and astomishly poor UI on spotifys part.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Plays whatever Spotify want to on the FREE version, they try to bully you effectively into paying for a subscription now by repeatedly playing the same advert again and again without variation and by throwing in music they think you may (or probably don't) want to hear. The FREE versions of the app gives you a good idea of the company and where things are going, Spotify used to be great, but first adverts, then removed features, only premium. +i don't think it's value for money comparatively.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: A disaster update Please bring back the color edit option for the Instagram story section. In the new update, you can only choose 3 background colors, all of which are awful. You are regressing over time, not progressing. You have already removed the letters in the left-hand or right-hand section. Now the color. Please return it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Why am I paying for something that doesn't work? Out of nowhere, the app started having problems and re-installing doesn't fix it. I used to be able to control the app from my phone's preview/lock screen, now I have to unlock my phone and go into the app to do it and even then it still freezes sometimes. It also doesn't interface with my car correctly anymore. Just a blank or frozen screen, defeating the purpose of car screen/mode. And I know it's not my device since all other apps work fine

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: HATE the new update. My shortcut is permanently frozen so i cant control the app in the background. Hide song feature broken. Very annoying & inconvenient. Will use other apps til fixed. & i miss the previous algorithm. When I would select a song it would play songs specifically from that same time period or genre; now no matter what I play it shuffles the same 20 songs :/ pls bring back the old method. Doesn't make sense why I am playing a song from 1992 and the next one that plays is from 2023

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Issues I've noticed in free and premium: - Can't stop a song being recommended globally. - Can't easily reorder tracks in a playlist. - No durations or album names in a playlist. - Not enough playlists update daily. - Go-to-radio not on mobile. - No Liked Songs recommendation radio. - Blends barely change and don't reflect your listening. - Premium is not worth it. - Even with premium, there are still in-app ads. - Cannot listen to your own playlists as portrait stories.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: 3/5 because it is a convenient, free app for music. However, the past month an ad has played every four songs or so, no more than 16-20 minutes, and each time it is almost 2 minutes of ads. What is prompting my review is the fact that I am now stopping use of the app again because every ad now is WcDonalds. I hear the ad three times each time it plays and it is glass to my eardrums at this point, and more frustrating than the app is worth. I'll use YouTube with my mobile data.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

We cant play songs of our choice, we can't play a particular part in a song, for that we have to play the whole song. Like what rubbish! Also, songs are recommended that are not even there in playlist. IT'S VERY ANNOYING!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I prefer Spotify over pandora. I'm only asking for 2 things. More control over my personal Playlist and more music than ads. Two songs. 4 ads. God forbid the song is over 5 minutes then 1 song 4 ads. And then I get the 30 minutes ad free and then I don't get the 30 minutes free. I know you are doing this in purpose to force us into premium. Quit being so shady.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Latest update has ridiculous Bluetooth feature so whenever I'm in a hotel I can take over another rooms playlist and they take over mine I have to listen to the podcast in the order they were released newest to oldest as opposed to oldest to newest. And now their newest problem is that the playlists I create stop after one or two songs. User interface is now terrible. I don't need all the reminders about what I've listened to. I will listen to one podcast one time and now it's on the top.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Service is fine, but the app is pure trash and not worth paying premium for. It's become terribly laggy and unresponsive, it crashes around the same time every morning, local files keep graying out and becoming unplayable, and every time I open the app to change the song it lags out and refreshes the UI and starts playing the previous song again.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: before ,I liked the fact that after searching for some music, it offered me similar music, now when I'm looking for something, it keeps repeating the same thing until I turn off the function myself. 2. before,No matter what music I left and what genre, when I was restarting the application, it was continuing from the same one, and now it serves me completely different things automatically when I log in again, and also the daily offers are almost all the same, it is not comfortable at all..

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Constantly and randomly says no internet connections when I very clearly can use EVERY other app that requires internet. This is frustrating as I use one of my playlists as an alarm in the morning, and if Spotify decides to just. Not work. No morning alarm. Edit: Restarting my device was the first thing I did, did absolutely nothing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It confuses me why I should have to continue paying for this app and have the ability to download music only to later be unable to access the music I've paid for the provelege to download. Any time I'm in an area without service, it throws up an error, saying a problem occurred. I'm not going to keep paying for this app if it's going to waste space by downloading music I then can't listen to because the app doesn't work the way it's supposed to. Canceling my subscription and uninstalling.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: In the era where technological applications are a boon, Spotify has literally gone back to a pre-historic era where-in it has curbed the usage by making so many restrictions. Honestly, I loved the application courtesy the plethora of music choices available to choose from but now, the free (I don't know if the word os right) version is nothing short of a punishment where-in, the user feels like a caged animal, unable to move freely at it's own will.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm really frustrated with this app. Whenever I connect my device to a bluetooth speaker, the app automatically starts playing random music, despite the fact that the autoplay feature has been turned off. I prefer to decide what to listen to and not rely on an algorithm to decide for me.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

So it continues stating that the same song is playing, when infact it's the next song in queue, but it doesn't update it at all.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I guess it's to stop people from having a library at all and only use their algorhythms. Sadly, that is not how many music fans listen to music. column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

No ability to customize home page. Way too expensive for what is given. Good selection of content at least.

I'm currently thinking of stopping subscribing Premium plan to move to APPLE MUSIC which never bombard us with tons of annoying "recommendations" bulls.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Make your app work better, because when i pay premium but i cant get any of my songs to play when tapped on, its irritating and immediatly makes me want to cancel my spotify subscription.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The lastest updates gives issues. Takes ages to load an album. Sometimes with the message "something went wrong" In offline mode it is even worse! Update, the new Update of 19 feb wont fix things. Offline mode is still broken. Update 2: the update of 26 feb partly fixes the issue, but still 80% give loading issues. Update 3: the update of 6 March won't fix the issue

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The enhanced shuffle feature is horribly implemented. There should be a simple way to reshuffle your playlist without activating enhanced shuffle, such as on the iPad app where you can hold down the shuffle button to view all shuffle options and select one. The primary bug is that if you shuffle a playlist which you have set to download for offline play, and enhanced shuffle becomes activated, it immediately tries to download all the enhanced-shuffle-added songs onto your device. This is a bug.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was annoying before but it's horrible after its new update! Suppose ur hearing a song, ur at 2nd para and u want hear the 1st para again then a message pops up EXPLORE PREMIUM üò° literally now we don't even have the right to play back. This app is freaking time wasting and it also does not gives lyrics too then why don't we hear on YouTube? We can atleast play back,see lyrics, etc.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: alright. new problems.. it takes FOREVER to get in and load up Spotify now, stops playing my songs and randomly tells me im offline DESPITE THE FACT I HAVE GOOD WIFI AND MOBILE DATA AS BACKUP! then, while im at school, it also stops working there. before all of this happened a couple days ago, it was working there PERFECTLY fine. i also get "30 mins of ad free listening," yet i do NOT get that at all and too many ads after nearly every song. pls fix this or help somehow...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: They removed the vibrate when right-swiping a song to add it to the queue. Why remove great haptic feedback like that? If you're going to remove something great like that, at least do a better visual cue by having the whole song's row light green since both success and failure currently quarter-cover before the animation drags back left. Additionally the "added to queue" text lags at displaying so I end up double adding. Never had this issue with the vibrate since that'd tell me it worked üò°

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Do you clowns know what "30 minutes of ad free music" means? Explain how there's an ad that says I'll get 30 mins of free music after it, just to play TWO 30 second ads right after the next song. Absolutely scummy app. Never using it again. New free version doesn't even allow you to select songs from your liked playlist LMAOOOOOOOOO TRASH APP.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: been using Spotify for quite awhile now, has everything i listen to and like. Update March 1st 2024: Ever since the last update it takes up to 5min to load the playlist and play a song, sometimes it doesn't even load at all, on or offline something needs to be fixed, this happens on multiple devices.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Says it'll give 30 minutes of uninterrupted music if I watch an ad. I watch the ad. It proceeds to give me an ad only 6 minutes later. I rarely use Spotify now, I've been mainly using YouTube and Pandora since you can actually control what you listen to. And pandora doesn't lie about uninterrupted music, in fact it'll give you an hour of uninterrupted music for ONE 15 second ad. Anyway, Spotify sucks. I'm moving my playlists and uninstalling it. Boooo üëé

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'd give 0 stars if I could. Deeply annoying app, considering the very poor playlist algorithms that play (at best) the same 100-200 songs despite being able to pull from a list of almost 2000 liked songs. Other annoying "features" include songs getting randomly removed from my Liked playlist, and the fact Spotify criminally underpays artists.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Horrible app, but all streaming is. If you even slightly value your music, steer clear of this app. And all apps, buy physical media instead. I figured I'd try out Spotify just so I'm not blindly knocking streaming, now I'm knocking streaming with valid reasoning. Nothing against the devs. It's just that no app could ever be as good as physical media. I said all of the same things about SoundCloud as well, but this app is slightly less horrible. Only slightly, though. Still absolute garbage.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I dont exactly know if this is an update or a glitch, but either way, it's frustrating. It was good in the first few weeks, but now It suddenly showed ads way too frequently and when I tried to listen to a song, ONE SONG alone, it suddenly autoplays other songs that I dont want to listen to. Songs are suddenly showing as playlists, and sometimes dont even play the song that I selected. One more thing, I can no longer repeat/playback a certain part in the song for some reason.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It used to be a good music streaming platform but with recent update I'm really very disappointed. Ads were never a problem for me and I understand they also need to make money. But now they are forcing us to buy premium for drag seeking and even shuffle. Like, c'mon these are the features for which we have to pay?!! Edit: Just great... now I can't even play songs of my choice. It will play some random song. Had been using it even after some limitations that were put previously but not anymore.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using this app for quite some time now, and even though it's overall the best app for music and podcasts, there are a few problems with it in my opinion: 1. the app has become insanely slow and often just outright crashes when you load a song, super annoying. 2. smart shuffle is a terrible feature that barely even suits my music taste... 3. the app is basically useless without premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Ok I had enough of it.....can barely find any lyrics of the song. Tons of ads all the time and it's too irritating sometimes. U just can't forward or rewind the song if u want. U can't choose it's sequence......and all for non-premium users. Like seriously why u let us even sign it. Previously atleast we could have done all that but now we can't. Like it's really frustrating to hear ads after every song. Not expected all this at all. Very bad experience even after using it for so long

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It works really good if you have great internet. When the data speeds are slow this app just goes downhill extremely fast, everything slows down by ALOT. Now I understand that it is probably loading, but why can it not load everything else that is downloaded already? I have to wait so long, at least a minute to load into the main menu, or any other tab, where as if I just put the thing into offline mode it'll be faster! I would do that, but turning it in and off everytime is unreasonable! Dice

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify doesn't seem to understand a very simple thing, and that is when you try to force users to buy a subscription, it has the exact opposite effect, it makes people want to go out of their way to find other alternatives, 1. this app won't let you play the songs you want to(on phone) 2. when it says "watch an ad for 30 minutes ad free" it will be ad free for 1 or 2 if your lucky 3, oh, and it auto puts songs into your playlists. Welp new "premium feature" is turning shuffle off

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to be so good and there were no adds you could baisicly do every thing you can do on premium but then it stopped. Every single time I turn on my phone it won't let me listen to podcast or songs. It also is getting rid of video podcasts. Like wth!!?? Anyways so much inappropriate content and all of the songs have lyrics but all of them say "you are offline lyrics are unavailable" bro this is a problem.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is overall too slow to ignore on my device, and sometimes the like button doesn't indicate that a song has already been liked. Otherwise, the experience is fairly seamless. Edit: I can confirm my older device was the major cause of the slow response time due to limited capabilities. I'm using a better device now & the experience is much smoother and faster. It's a good app but it's unfortunate that it demands such processing power that it slows down terribly on a low-end Android phone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I used to enjoy this app, but now its really bothersome. I can't play the song that I want, can't listen to the part of the song, you have to listen from the begining. This app has started to deny the basic features for non premium members . They are basically forcing a user to buy the premium membership , all for those basic functions that one can enjoy one any other platform . Spotify used to be my favourite music application. But now,its just become a really bad one . I will never recomend it

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Continual problems. Why remove playlist radio? Why are my custom playlists suddenly out of order (I like to listen to some bands in chronological order of their albums and singles)? Why do my 95 hour playlists manage to play the same 50 songs over and over again? Why is there no true shuffle with no repeat option? So many issues in the last couple years, but these are the tip of the iceberg. Every "update" may improve one aspect of the app, but suddenly there are 5 new issues that pop up.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Frustrating and buggy app, especially when listening to podcasts. Whenever my phone changes from wifi to mobile data Spotify refuses to continue playing the podcast. I usually need to manually resume. Occasionally it decides to jump to the last podcast in the series and I then have to manually find where I had left off. This is especially annoying as the scrolling feature can sometimes be very slow. Randomly Spotify also likes to jump to the beginning of the track.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know why Spotify thinks "smart shuffle" is such a great feature but it's not. The song matching is garbage and it keeps turning itself on after I've turned it off. Why would you make this trash the default shuffle?! What, you noticed nobody liked the wand so you just made it harder to avoid?! I'm maybe one more bad change away from going back to downloading my own MP3 files again because at least that's an inconvenience I can control.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify always was my first choice for an music app... But things have now changed they don't even let you select a particular song more than 6 times... what is the meaning of Playlist now if they want to shuffle the Playlist and play the music as they want... they doesn't even let us skip song more than 6 times and the worse part is that you can't even rewind the song or skip to the point which you want to listen you've to listen whole song from the beginning to listen a particular line...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium user here, I would give this app a higher rating if the lockscreen widget doesn't glitch out, the widget randomly appears out of nowhere, remains in a previous song I listened to with it's skip function not working at all( repeat function works though) and after I close the app it disappears and doesn't come back even after selecting another song. It's annoying to turn on the phone and open the app everytime to replay the song or skip to another song,i hope you would look into this issue

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It never closes in the background of your phone. Will drain your battery. Even if you force stop it, it still opens right back up. So it is always draining your battery in the background. I have to delete it until I want to use it. I don't trust an app that needs that much access to my phone. 24/7, when I only listen like 1 or 2 days a week?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3:
Spotify has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. There are bugs in the software. Just 2 days ago, the app kept on playing in the background even after several attempts to pause and shut it down. It used the entire top-up I had for my audio book. I wasn't asking for refund, just if they can get me the lost hours on the top up. ü§∑‚Ä?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Dissapointed

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Whoever added it should rethink their actions because it's helping nobody.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: when the app works, it is a great experience to simply listen to music. Curated lists are well done, but spotify is terrible for *experiencing* music. Not specific to any genre, your recommendations and radio playlists will usually consist of the same 10 to 20 songs you've frequented. This will drag your enjoyment by a ton, burning you out on new and old music you've thought maybe sounded good together, but now in every recommendation and radio you want to experience something new in.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is alright. It used to be better. Mainly, my issue is that I have hundreds of songs in most playlists. My liked playlist has 1977 which I'll admit is low. But anyway, when I hit shuffle and add recommendations, that doesn't mean I want you to only cycle through the same 5 songs. It means shuffle the whole playlist and add some new stuff. When are you going to finally fix this issue? It's known. There are memes about it. What am I paying you for?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Great app but the downside would have to be it's size!! I have to delete Spotify at least once a month or it'll end up taking a ton of space. Just deleted it a few minutes ago because it was using 12GB of storage. I don't download or save anything which makes this really confusing and sometimes obnoxious. Having to reset my app to update another app or if I need more space for photos lol. On the other hand I pay for premium and it's amazing, non-stop music literally 3-4 hours a day

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the app. It connects to Alexa with ease and can connect to multiple devices. Update unfortunately I hate that it just stops playing. I'm not connected to any other devices and I have play in background enabled. It's super annoying to pay for premium service and it doesn't work well.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Excessive amount of ads. I use Spotify daily and I get that you have to pay your artists and allat but 7 ads back to back? Seriously? Longer ad break then most of the songs I listen to. Also, sometimes when it says "30 minutes of uninterrupted listening" it plays one song and then proceeds to play like three ads. I know you want people to get Spotify premium, but God it's excessive. As a minor that doesn't get paid very much, I can't afford premium and just wanna listen to music sometimes man.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This is the worst music listening app to ever exist.... why let the non premium users sign up !!!! when you won't allow them the basic things like song replay , shuffle , change of song , rewind etc !!! Each day the app goes on becoming worse and worse... loved this app when initially installed it 4 years ago...but I just can't keep up with these stupid premium ad ons . Basic facilities shouldn't be a part of premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I opened app, heard 1 song from weekly list, then ads promising 30 minutes uninterrupted. App then switched away from weekly list to one "recommended". I switched back to weekly list, and got several more ads. Then app played 2 songs from weekly list, and then more ads. I stopped listening to file this complaint. I am not coming back soon.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is getting worse each day, it's premium features are making it so unpleasant. If you want to have worst experience while listening to music, install it, otherwise just download some other apps as they are much better than spotify. I used to love this app so much, but I hate opening it now. Their focus has gone just to make money and not consider the ppl who do not and can not buy their premium features. What is the point of even using it when I can't listen to the songs I wish to play.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I uninstalled the app because once I received many ads. I think also the ads have noticeably higher quality audio than Spotify's free version or the paid version, and are quite long than other apps with ads. I was listening to a podcast and started to get confused until I realized the ads have been speaking for quite a bit! Also the music playlist lacked variety even with it's recommendations. Hope Spotify brings back the usual ads.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: When I end a call instead of going back to the podcast I was listening to, the app plays music. Really annoying when you are driving. The app also just stops working sometimes. Additionally, when I am parked and playing through Bluetooth, I cannot access video, not driving, parked. Going to your last played would also be a lovely option to have. This app has just been really annoying me and I long for the days of the old music player apps on our phones. Everything was easier to access.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Travelling to Japan for 3 weeks. Downloaded playlists, made sure my premium account would work in different countries. Spotify says it would. Great! Imagine my surprise when I get to Japan and the app says "something went wrong" on login. I can't change my region when I have premium because it doesn't match my payment info. Free account works. What a joke, canceling this joke of a service and going to Tidal. Bye Spotify, thanks for traveling without music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Dodgy subscription!... I'm no long going to be using premium anymore, each time I've paid for premium the renew fee is always taken out earlier then its ment to (always after 3 weeks), take my money when its convenient for Spotify and never get a dang notice to notify me that my subscription is due... 3 times you've done this and put me in debt/overdraft

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is practically useless without premium, and it's kinda annoying sometimes bc I downloaded the app so I could listen to music offlineüíÄ. Also, every time I get the lyrics, it says, "couldn't load the lyrics for this song." and the most annoying thing is that it automatically goes on shuffle mode and another annoying thing is that I only get to watch the first few seconds from the music video then it replays, so it's practically like gifs. Overall, the app itself is not so bad

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Bro, the new update sucks! Now I HAVE to buy premium just to listen to my music in order! Plus, when I search up my favorite songs and push play. It plays a different song! Not to mention, I can't skip to my favorite songs either! Dear spotify, bring the old version back!! Sorry, uninstalling.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: App is fine overall even if I use the free version. Great choices of songs, I like the song recommendation feature and there are a lot of different artists on the platform, even smaller ones. It's easy to use and easily personalized. However the ads are starting to really bother me. I've used the app for a while, and they were fine before but now I usually get two ads in a row every two songs. Even when the app offers 30 minutes ad-free, I get the usual amount of ads. It's really annoying.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a pretty good app to be honest. the free version isn't as bad as people say it is, and obviously some features aren't available as the developers have to make a living. I've tried tidal, musi but they aren't as user friendly and as interactive as Spotify is. The audio quality is also good enough for me to enjoy music. However, the ads come up more often (1-2 times every fifteen minutes) than Spotify says it would (1 per hour).

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is definitely known for one of the best libraries of music and podcasts. However, in the state it's in right now, it's borderline unusable. My issue is that the app itself keeps crashing and exiting out. I can't count how many times I have to reopen spotify and refresh it to get the audio back. And if it's a podcast, it will reset a good amount of time back.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was great, I love listening to music and it was perfect for me. But, the recent changes make the free version completely useless. You cannot turn of shuffle unless you have premium, you cannot see lyrics unless you have premium, you cannot even use the basic functions. I was fine with listening to a few ads, but this is too much. If I am not even able to do the most basic things why even have a free version then? Please change it back I am not satisfied with the way things are now:(

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Music for any mood is one of the best features on the app. The UI is clean, simple and easy to navigate. New Music alerts from my favourite artists is a feature I love as well. The app has been great so far but I don't like the fact that a song or playlist will be cached and after a couple of plays (<20), it stops automatically. I'd have to put on my WiFi or mobile data to continue listening even on Premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Revised:2024. Spotify used to be fantastic. Now I turn it on and walk away and it plays maybe 3 songs before it just stops, silence, until I have to stop what I am doing, go back to my device, log in and then it will suddenly start again. I thought maybe my phone was stopping it as it went into save battery mode, but no. It just sucks. 2021. Absolutely love

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify stopped suggesting songs. If I look something up, the app only plays the song I looked up and nothing else. I have to be looking for tracks individually. This started happening out of the blue. All my settings are correct, I have reinstalled the app, my internet connection is working, but nothing seems to fix the problem (that didn't exist before). If it continues like this, I'll be cancelling my subscription.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know why Spotify is the dominant streaming app. It is awful. Bad interface, bad song recommendations, bad shuffling, bad queue management. The list goes on. I hear the same 6 songs no matter what starting song I choose. I can't remove songs from the queue it generates. Just awful.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Look, the service Spotify provides is great. But the fact is that the interface of the app changes fairly often. The intention is of course to improve the user experience, but that is exactly why I can't comprehend that I now have to dig through 3 layers of menu settings to access the equalizer. Spotify is an audio service where 99% of the content is either music or podcasts, if I have to dig through 3 layers of settings to acces the equalizer everytime, that is just plain out tiring....

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Now it's not letting me skip at all despite just opening it for the first time this morning and haven't done ANY skips yet today. Why the hell would I pay this app money when I can't even trust the free version to work how it's supposed to?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Not possible to play all artists on shuffle. App keeps running in the background after closing it. I have to force stop it in the settings (edit: not working anymore). Also, when restarting the phone. Ads don't follow my musical preferences and are too loud. Sometimes I think it's on purpose to bully me into buying premium.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I dont usually write reviews for apps, but this is an exception. i used to love spotify, but now everytime i open the app, nothing loads properly and anytime i try to search or play a song/playlist, nothing works. when this happens, i usually restart my phone and it'll work but that doesnt always happen. its getting exhausting. im tired of having to restart my phone several times and reinstall the app, just for it to STILL NOT WORK. dont tell me to reinstall, i already have and that didnt work.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

This not only eats up my time but also my data allowance, as I can't listen to music offline.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
