column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is not at all user-friendly. I can't for the life of me find a 'help' option that many apps have, which I remember there being, so there should be one. The 'settings' icon has gone for me, so I now have to go through my profile to get to my settings. There is also a problem with one of my my playlists. It swapped a song with another, and even if I swap them back through editing the playlist, it doesn't actually change it. Please fix this

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Based purely on the podcast section. Unintuitive UI. Impossible to pick a series and play through each episode. Ads in podcasts even though I pay premium. Struggle to find where podcasts I follow can be found. Constantly showing me podcasts I am not subscribed to trying to get me to subscribe, of which I have zero intrest in. Easiest fix would be a 'playlist'option for podcasts, exactly the same as for music on the app.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Some other problem has come up. Music periodically stops playing after one song. For example, when I play the first song on an album (which successfully plays through), the next song does not play. It is worth noting that the music player shows that the next song is playing when it isn't (this has gone on for as long as one hour on one song). Some kind of bug perhaps. Please address this in the next update.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app has served me right for a long time now and I loved it. Now I fricking hate it. My playlist that's downloaded keeps undownloading when I get off of wifi. What's the point? Also, there a random part of my playlist that keeps coming to the top of the playlist no matter what I do. I tried editing the playlist, I tried deleting the songs then re-adding them, but nothing works. It's the most annoying thing ever. Please fix this and let me have my old playlist back. Then it would be 5 stars.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I am taking a Star off my review due to the gargantuan amount of ads, I would understand one here and there, but I once got 5 ads back to back for a 2 minute song. Otherwise, I would consider this a great application for music, as it has introduced me to many new bands and genres I probably would not have heard of before, especially with the podcasts. It's crazy to think a mere 2 decades ago, It would've cost an arm and a leg for all these albums that are now so easily available.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Good music and podcast selection, BUT. The devices override each other and this Is a major problem. You can not stream from one spotify account on 2 separate devices simultaneously. (For instance if I'm driving in my car and using my phone and a family member at home uses a home device). Additionally, once the secondary device is activated, it overrides the phone even if spotify is not in use!! This is a major issue that should be fixed.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Been having an ok time since i bought premium. No more incessant ads is nice. that was, until my playlists started going WRONG. i cannot sort. i cannot edit. making a new list with the same albums still magically teleports songs all the way to the top, swapping them with whatever is SUPPOSED to be there. deleting the errant song only brings in the next song from the errant song's album, not whatever is next in the list.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As many others (both here and on the Spotify forums) have noted, there's an increasingly widespread bug (esp on Android devices) that affects song playback, causing songs to "play" with no audio until songs are manually skipped. I've been dealing with this bug for over a year, and it has only become more frequent, rather than being addressed. CS has offered no helpful advice. I've been a Premium subscriber for 10 years, but enough is enough. I'm switching to Tidal, and you probably should too.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I left Pandora because it would constantly crash. I was enjoying Spotify until certain rap albums was added to my profile, then they will start playing while I'm listening to the music that I picked and enjoy. Now, today while listening to my music, it started switching the songs. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app and nothing has changed. I am beyond frustrated, and the only thing I can do is complain about.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is great!... for the price. Interface is easy to use and the algorithm works wonder in suggestions. Bug with listening device selection was fixed so I gave it another star, but now I've realized that the "hide this song" from a specific playlist doesn't work. We need an incognito mode! Private session is annoying to activate, doesn't work with Google Home and it doesn't specify if it's the same as incognito.I listen to repetitive music for sleeping that I do not want it on my algorithm.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The mobile version is awful in comparison to the desktop version. Not letting me pick a song that I want to listen to - the dumbest decision ever. All you can do is start listening to your playlist, which is shuffled randomly. Have I also mentioned the fact that you can skip a song only 6 times per hour while listening to your randomly shuffled playlist? Use something else if you want to listen to music on a mobile device. Atrocious application.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Has cool personalized playlists, and a variety of podcasts to explore. The fact that disabling shuffle mode is a premium-only feature is tremendously annoying, however. If I just want to listen to one song at the start of a playlist, I can't, because of this unnecessary restriction. I have just a few liked songs, why does Spotify have to add some more random songs in the like playlist without my consent??? I understand that Premium must restrict a few features, but why this one?

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm about done with spotify. I understand that if I don't buy the premium membership I have to listen to commercials. They are a business and need revenue to operate. But after two or three songs I get 3-4 long commercials I can't skip after getting the basic info, I can't help but think why not go back to my radio or other apps. Spotify is not worth it if you don't get premium. I'll go back to other apps and my radio. But I will say, podcast side I'm good with, just not the music side.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app requires the option to shut off auto replay. It is intrusive, to say the least. I've reached out, chatted, and followed every instruction given, and it seems that even the staff doesn't know how to stop the app from playing automatically. Even if Spotify wasn't an app previously used, it will begin playing when connected to the car.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Excessive amount of bugs all around. The music often won't play and I have to restart the app, the menu for "show artist/album" also often won't load, and when spotify is open on the computer as well, the problems just compound. The only reason I put up with the bugs is the great student discount, but considering how the app has been the last 2-3 months, this may well be the end...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Excessive amount of bugs all around. The music often won't play and I have to restart the app, the menu for "show artist/album" also often won't load, and when spotify is open on the computer as well, the problems just compound. The only reason I put up with the bugs is the great student discount, but considering how the app has been the last 2-3 months, this may well be the end...

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a mainstream app, so there's not a lot to say in terms of use; you know it works in most aspects, it's a popular app. I will say I have one particular glitch that makes me rewind an episode in order to make the audio work; it cuts out at the start of an episode so it's completely silent and will NOT work unless I hit the rewind 15 second button. It makes the ads start over too. üòí

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify in that I can select songs to create my own playlist. That being said however, 99% of the time I start listening to my playlist and after the first song I get a series of ads and then says that I will get 30 minutes of ad free music. One song later and I'm getting repeat ads all over again. I understand I will have to endure the ads without premium, but I don't want ads after every song. Also, the shuffle plays the same 5 songs over and over out of my 200 on my list.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Great library, generally easy to use. Negatives: Search feature sometimes just doesn't work. I'm connected to wifi, but it will hang for 5 minutes plus without giving any results. Just the loading circle. UX with using it in airplane mode is also really poor, even in offline mode sometimes it just won't play downloaded songs. Still better than YouTube music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using this app for last 3 to 4 years. This app is just becoming like other apps. I can't even choose what song I want to play at the moment or even skip songs without the premium feature. Not even giving half an hour playtime without ads. Other than that I was logging in the account with premium invite by a family member and I can't even log into that. It shows the address match then shows error in the next tab. Just becoming worse day by day.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Editing on 1/28/24. I don't know what happened, but my playlists are getting messed up. I have the set up in a specific manner, and the first song is bumped down somewhere else into my playlist and replaced by a completely different song in the playlist. This isn't happening on my desktop version, and it's getting rather annoying trying to fix this issue.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Beware free users. They made the free experience horrendous, no doubt on purpose. Even if you watch ads for "30mins of free music," it'll still make you watch ads every single time you switch albums regardless. If you have playlists, it forcefully plays songs that aren't in it. I would say premium is worth it, but they just jacked up the prices on all plans. Might be worth if they made the app function better but it's exactly the same, just more expensive.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Wish it cost less for premium, but it's almost worth the subscription honestly. I HATE ads in my music, and some days I skip even the songs I love the most. The "made for you" lists are almost always on point, with songs I either already love, or brand new faves. Love that the updated "add to Playlist" feature FINALLY lets you add a song to many playlists at once; I've been waiting for this update since I started making playlists originally! Still, they're charging about 5$ too much, IMO.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have usually had a good time using the app, however, as of late audio has cutting out every few seconds. This is extremely annoying and it's been happening since around the later weeks of December, like probably a week before Christmas. I'll have to go a head and pause and un pause, or in some case have to rewind the song I'm listening to. Oh and this only happens if I'm not in the app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Longtime premium subscriber. This app has gotten so buggy. Podcasts won't play, won't track progress, or will freeze randomly. Car mode is annoying. Songs glitch and mislabel on my Playlists so the song playing is not the song I selected to play. What the heck happened? App used to run smoothly. I'm seriously considering switching to another music streaming service.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know what happened, but it rearranged the songs in my playlist. Every time I try to correct the order, it takes the first couple songs and places them in the center of the list. When I put those songs back at the top, it takes a random song and places it above the ones I moved. And when I move that song, it takes the next couple song below it and putsthem elsewhere in the list. I know this seems silly, but it infuriates me. I'd like these songs in specific order, but it won't let me.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app works but is not very good. If you search for a song, it'll play the song once, but after that, you need good luck to try and find that song. Oh, but wait, you only have six song skips every thirty minutes. When using this app as an alarm, it changes the song used each time the alarm goes off. If there's a playlist, it'll show the name of the album, but not songs. Plus, it plays the songs in whatever order the app says is best. If you pick one song, it'll play a complete other song.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Was frustrated when they made us to restrict to got to previous songs and choose the playback feature even after listening/watching loads of Advts. Now I can't even listen to my songs from my playlist and skip the songs with restricted access. Why the hell do they make us watch/listen to the Ads. No use of keeping this app installed anymore. Wynk Seems to be the best alternative.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: As a podcast player, this app is a bit annoying when trying to listen to a queue of episodes. For such a popular player, I can't believe that they have no way to sort them by oldest to newest on Android, only newest to oldest. Update: for some reason the app is shuffling my "my episodes" list even though it isn't an option a user can turn on and off.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: One of the worst music apps Ive ever had. No matter how updated everything is, it cuts off in the middle of songs and when I open the app again, the song is restarted. It also skips in the middle of songs like Im listening to a CD. I will listen to an ad for 30 minutes of music, it will play one song and them go back to 4 commercials before playing only 2 songs.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium Subscription I only use for Podcasts. Since update a few hours ago podcasts are moving out of order in my playlists. The top podcast I am listening to moves to somewhere towards the middle. The podcast that is in that place moves to the top. I am unable to edit the playlist. Received support feedback to update phone reinstall app and restart phone. Did not work.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I been a user for 6 years now and I seen more and more problems with the app in the past year then the years before. Updates are patchy and the more recent issue that hasn't gone away in updates is the kicking out of current playlist after connecting or disconnecting to any Bluetooth devices. Once this happens the app will start playing a random playlist not picked. Also once disconnected the app reads "Offline" then back online. Another recurring issue is Queued songs clearing

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly really good (for me at least) when it comes to listening to music. I have premium, and imo it's worth it, but that might just be me. but when I tried to reorganize my main playlist just to make everything easier on my perfectionist ah brain, it keeps moving VALENTINE (M√•neskin) to the top of the Vocaloid section. That's less of a criticism more of an inconvenience, but it's really annoying cuz I get bothered by the little things. Also sometimes it just won't play a song despite being on

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Unbearable for non-premium users. Not like it used to be. You can't fastfoward to specific parts of songs, you can't replay them instead you have to go back into the app and re-click on the song to listen to it again, you can't go back to listen to the previous song. Not even an option for a queue to see any upcoming songs either. It's kind of over the top at this point. I understand that you're a company and are desperate for people to get premium but this is simply doing too much. Do BETTER.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Update. Clearly you either listen to things the Spotify way or not at all. This fact remains. They changed feature priorities though. Automix no longer turns on automatically. The new *it* feature is Smart Shuffle it turns on automatically, despite one of the whole selling points of paying is that you can listen in any order. Try to turn off? The app crashes. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, restarted my phone. App remains absolute garbage with no concern for the user.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Uaed to be perfect, never had any issues until the last few months maybe. Last year the app randomly stopped working on my computer, so I have to use the website on there. Also, the app on my phone is slow and sometimes totally unresponsive. Pausing/Playing/Skipping songs either takes 5+ seconds to work, or just doesnt happen at all. A few times a song will continue to play when I shut down the app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Bring back the Playlist radio function as soon as possible! The "Enhance" feature is really not good for finding songs! I really don't get, why spotify keeps removing features that people use! üòëüòë Edit: This app is getting increasingly worse. I only want to listen to music. Instead I now get shorts? Please at least add an option to remove the shorts!!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Needs an option to block songs from playing entirely. There's an artist I enjoy but one of his songs irritates the absolute hell out of me. No matter how often I remove from playlist it always gets shuffled to a new one. My only option was to block the artist entirely since I really hate hearing the song and if Im doing something while I listen to spotify I cant always go over and skip it. It feels like such a simple thing that it amazes me how its not already part of spotify.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm not really sure what's going on, but several times per month, the app will not play on any of my devices. I have several Alexa speakers (Studio, Echo, Show) and a Denon home theatre system. My Wi-Fi will be working great, I will have restarted my phone, updated and restarted all apps, rebooted my Deco mesh system, but still, the device list will be empty except for a random Firestick from somewhere in the house. Why??? Then magically in a few hours, they all come back.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Been using Spotify for years and years. Tye selection of content has always been incredible, but the app itself gets worse with each update. Artist radios are getting worse about content, podcasts have gotten miserable to listen to, especially when you're deep into the back catalog. It's they're actively trying to make the user experience worse with each update.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I absolutely love the app but, there are way too many ads. It's like they're doing what Pandora used to do which was play an ad after literally every song. But it's worse with Spotify. It'll play anywhere between three and seven ads at a time. Spotify devs REALLY need to fix this issue. Even if it's by removing at least one or two ads played, I would be satisfied.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Every time I try to turn off smart shuffle and I have something in queue it skips forward. Please just let it be an option in settings to turn it off completely. Also I'd like if the DJ didn't have sets completely unrelated to my music taste. There's been some crashes and audio problems too lately. My music will often change volumes a couple times. Other than this I love Spotify and recommend it highly.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to be really good but now it has just been focused on how to make people buy the premium version... You don't allow me to rewind or play on loop, I can't skip more than 6 songs in a hour... you are just denying basic services... I'd rather listen to music on YouTube Music it's just better than you it just doesn't allow me to play music in the background well that works for me atleast I can play what I want to listen to.... I don't recommend this app at all... I am deleting it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The fact that my playlists now have limits for organization is so annoying. As well as the fact that this problem isn't on computers, it's only on mobile if you don't have premium. It's really inconvenient, especially since this wouldn't happen if you switch to premium. It just feels like a money grab at this point. The limits I have with the playlists, just because I don't have premium, is so annoying. I may as well go back to using Amazon music instead

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It used to start where I left off whether it was a podcast or song, but now when I open the app, it just goes to a random playlist and starts a song. Even if it I have Spotify in the background to open another app, when I go back into it, it will stop what I was listening to and go into another playlist. Very annoying, especially since I'm paying them money.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The Android app has gone steadily downhill since 2019. They've shown time and time again where all of their efforts have gone. Apple, podcasts, and ebooks. It constantly freezes, won't connect to Alexa, and takes long to open. They've removed feature after feature and replaced it with nothing. Where did playlists based off playlists go? Where did daily playlists go? Where did good song recommendations go?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify just keeps getting worse and worse for those who can't afford Spotify's premium plans. You get multiple ads after a couple of songs, the "30 minutes of ad free listening" is 15 at best, and to top it all off, smart shuffle is constantly enabled on playlists. You used to be able to turn the smart shuffle off in settings, but now you can't. The regular shuffle button isn't even an option unless you pay for premium. I'm extremely frustrated with how unusable it's become for free plan users.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Attempting to listen to an album is an exercise in frustration on a free account. The track list is set to shuffle with no way to disable, "suggested" songs are inserted after every three tracks, and ads are just as frequent despite an alert popping up advising that the next 30 minutes will be ad-free. It's good app if you want to be fed a stream of music like Pandora does, but unless you're paying, there's no way to truly curate your own listening experience.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: When it works, it's great. But it constantly disconnects when playing over Bluetooth, or just won't open at all. Sometimes, it does this fun thing where it decides it's going to skip over what I'm listening to and just start playing something random, and it won't let me go back to what I was originally playing. I have to restart my phone just to get it to work again. So great, especially when I'm driving!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have paid for my spotify but it still shows I am on the free plan. Kindly have this fixed! Thanks. I have tried everything including updating it,emailing, restarting my phone and it us getting quite annoying that I have to listen to music with adverts, yet I am on a subscription which makes it really frustrating. I need it fixed as soon as possible.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: App is usually awesome, but the introduction of the new enhanced shuffle has completely ruined the UI as it will randomly turn itself on mid playlist. I've disabled it in the settings and still does it. It is unbelievably frustrating especially as you have to restart the playlist to turn it off, so end up listening to the same songs multiple times. This need fixing for 5 stars.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Using Spotify without a subscription is a test in patience. The constant interruptions by ads are beyond annoying and disrupt the flow of music. The limited skips and inability to play specific songs make the free version feel like a teaser rather than a functional music app. I understand the need for ads, but the frequency and duration make the free experience less enjoyable. It's almost as if they want to push users into subscribing.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The addition of smart shuffle has been awful. Switching between shuffle on and off has become buggy, requiring repeated turning off and on for it to stay off when switching between songs. When you want to stop shuffling at one song so you can go to the next in the playlist, it resets to the first song in the playlist, rather than where you were at. It's unintuitive, annoying, and buggy. This feature alone makes me want to switch entirely to SoundCloud.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You have an Ad Glitch! Stressful. When opening the app for the first time in a day, it will initially play an ad or a set of ads and then the music will start. And then Normally, you won't see another ad for some time. But you have a glitch where it will play the set of ads, then we'll play one song, then another set of ads will play only after one song! This is surely a glitch. Please Fix. Will update back to five stars after addressing issue. Note: I'm a previous Spotify Premium subscriber.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The reason I'm rating this so high is because I love music and this app brings me music. Constant tiny pauses in the music, and some very long pauses, sometimes the music stops and you can see the song timer still moving. When you look for a Playlist of any kind the computer will just bundle your favorite list and play that so its hard to find new music. And if you're looking for instrumental music you will inevitably get some with lyrics in that Playlist.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: A couple of things: Firstly, the app is decent. However, idk why, but lately, when listening to podcasts, the app won't automatically play the next episode. It looks like it's going to, but nothing happens. The only way to actually get the next episode to work is to close the app and reopen it. Secondly, I have a paid subscription, yet I'm still getting ads. Thankfully, I can skip them by fast forwarding them, but still, it should be ad free.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Subscription REQUIRED!!! I have been using this app for years. from free to subscription. the songs that plays here sounds better than the others. But once I stopped using subscription I found some fatal features that's newly locked by subscription such as loop, jump to specific time, and the old frustrating overlapping ads with 30secs each with different volume which often makes me jumpy when it shows! And not often after an ad it play something else which means I have to search my song again.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium user here! Lately I've been having a problem logging in on my other device. It keeps telling me that I don't have any internet connection although I have. I've tried every fix that I found on google but nothing worked. I even tried installing older versions of spotify but no luck. And this bug seems to go on for years for other users. It would suck to discover one day that I can't access my account at all, not even to cancel my subscription. Then this would turn into a legal matter.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've downloaded all of my liked songs onto my phone. When I play a song, then select another one on the list, the playback just stops completely and I can't play songs anymore until I restart the app. I've cleared the cache, reinstalled, changed battery restrictions. Nothing work. This has been months now and I pay for premium. This should be a priority. Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The radio algorithm is repetitive. Adding to a que is clunky and ineffective. There's no "play next" button. You can't add a whole album to a que and it stay in order. You can't cue up multiple albums and them stay in order. I hat this program, but Google Music shutdown and this is slightly better than YouTube Music. Anyone have a good option out there? Edit: the longer I use this, the more I hate it. It's so clunky. Edit: with every update the app gets worse...

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Loved Spotify until it started turning 'smart shuffle' on by itself. That really damaged my trust, when I tried to use familiar songs to manage an anxiety attack and got something completely different without any warning. No one wants this feature and there's no option to permanently disable it. I've started looking into other streaming services.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm in love this app and have used it for multiple years, but lately I've been having issues with it: - The first songs of a playlist randomly changing place and replacing each other, without me even trying to do so, and if I attempt to fix this, it'll ignore any changes I do. - No longer having the ability to list playlists on my profile; the button for it disappeared completely and I have no way to do this unless I go on desktop, which is rather inconvenient. Please fix these bugs asap üôè

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Currently experiencing an issue with custom playlists where when adding multiple albums to one, random songs will jump to the top of the playlist and when I move them back to the place I wanted them, a different song(s) jumps to the top instead. Very annoying. Another issue - when listening to music via my phone speakers, the volume will randomly lower by itself.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The newest update is glitched. It switches where the first song in the playlist is with another song in the playlist. There's no way to fix it, because if you change the order of the songs back to normal on mobile, then the songs get reversed on desktop. Please fix it so that the order of songs on my playlists is consistent and normal on all devices.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Experiencing a number of issues the past few weeks. Curated playlists in specific track orders are now jumbled and if edited are altered again on saving. Since yesterday, playlists and albums are no longer playing in correct order. For example, played Led Zeppelin II, first track, but then jumped to a 2010s dance track. Service is almost unusable for the purpose I use it. No tracks are queued and have attempted all recommended fixes including reinstall, but still no improvement.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The amount of ads is getting out of control. After EVERY song, there's an ad. And it's typically at least 2 or more ads in a row. It wasn't this bad when I had first got the app, usually it would play way more songs before an ad. Please, please, please, I literally beg of you, reduce the amount of ads. Also, the ads are never relevant to me. Even if I do the "Not interested" I still get the same ad. This app used to be great, but it's annoying to use now.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I can find many songs in spotify, the experience was great, until they made almost everything premium. Not able to select and hear songs by our choice, not able to see lyrics for every song, not able to skip songs, not able to add any song to queue, not able to play songs in loop etc. Each of the following things always need premium for them to work I hope *at least* spotify changes even just 1 thing I mentioned. Let everyone, not only me, listen to songs in peace.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app has always been buggy, but for a while it seemed like they fixed it. Recently it's gone back to being slow, saying I'm offline even though my phone is connected to the internet, not actually downloading my downloaded music, and buffering for long periods of time. It also will just randomly disconnect or pause itself now. Why was all of the progress from the last few years lost over the last few months? Very frustrating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Getting frustrated with this darn app! So everytime I switch from one Bluetooth device to another, it plays the exact same songs in the exact same order! For example, I'll listen to music on my earbuds on my way to my car, then switch to my card Bluetooth, and it'll play the same songs I just listened to. Same goes on any devices I use. It's getting so frustrating that it's almost easier to download my own music and use another music app on my phone. This shouldn't happen with any music app!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Offline mode is a nightmare. When you open the app, it takes for ever to load. Once it is open and you try to open a playlist it takes forever again, that's if it opens at all. More times then not it says there is a problem. Have to get online, switch back to online mode, get the playlist to open then switch back to offline mode. Major pain, I also do not have unlimited data!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was such a good app to listen music, with lyrics and a variety of great music. You could even explore new songs with it's new feature in the playlist section, it would add songs in the playlist according to the particular kind of playlist. You could even put a song on repeat, now? Nah. It has become trash. Every little thing needs a premium now. A person can't even listen music peacefully without spending money on apps. As the app gets new updates, it keeps getting worse. Disappointing.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Almost every month there is a feature, which definitely was authored by "not very intelligent" person. As example - you are not able to remove song from favorite in app anymore. Why? Algorithm for songs is very lazy - if you're listening song of certain genre, this song will be in playlist for months. Every "renewal" for playlist - mostly shanking up plus not or two new songs at best.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I dont want to notice updates to this app, just play my music! Smart shuffle is so annoying, I have to click the button five or six times to turn normal shuffle on and off with all the lag from removing and adding the smart recommendations, and Ive not used it once. Constantly changing the system for liked songs is also irritating, it was fine 6,7 years ago, leave it alone! Better algorithmic suggestions are awesome but make new places for them, dont mess up tried and true systems.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Impossible to find anything, difficult to navigate. Pay to skip songs? That's like paying to unlock thumbnails. Sometimes I search a song, find the exactly right title, and it's labeled as "song", but it then instead plays something else entirely. I click "don't play this" and it says "song removed from list". What list? It's one song. It's labeled "song" not "list". I asked for a song, and was told I could listen to it, but actually not? "Browse music, but actually no you're out of skips sorry"

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the crossfads opgion and love the transition between the songs. HOWEVER, it mostly sucks on mobile, why should I get premium just to pick a song from MY playlist, its my playlist, I made it, why can't I choose which song I want to play first? Or why can I only skip six songs per hour? Not to mention I cant turn off smart shuffle or regu√±ar shuffle for any playlist, its so annoying.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: wish i could give this app a negative rating. ive been using spotify for years now and i loved it because of its interface and large variety in music. unfortunately the app has put even the most basic features like looping and rewinding songs behind a paywall. definitely not good marketing, pretty sure many people wouldn't want to pay for the bare minimum.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have listened to music on this app for so long. But the new features are ridiculous. I understand that you want users to buy subscription,so you auto-shuffle the list. But this smart shuffle doesn't even play songs from a playlist when it is specifically asked to do so. Now Spotify is irritating. I took a week-subscription and was disappointed with the experience. I was told that I got 14 days subscription but the download list disappeared in a week. Will switch apps soon

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The "Spotify Connect" has been the bane of my existence. Please remove it or allow the feature to be turned off. This feature" is more of a hindrance and intrusive than any app I've seen to date. This feature automatically turns on Spotify whenever I turn off Netflix or Youtube or when I take my headphones off my ear (my when my headset comes off). I listen to videos a lot with my headphones across multiple apps and when spotify starts playing I get enraged. Close to deleting.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I can't even listen to a song without getting bombarded with 9 ads, it used to be 30 mins of music before the next ad but now it's uncontrollable. I cant even listen to music without this shuffling thing, it's out of my control and it puts on songs I don't want, what's the point of using Spotify if it puts on the music you don't want. I get that Spotify wants to make premium more enjoyable for those who buy it so that more people can buy it but the updates are completely unhelpful and annoying

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly, I used to love spotify so much. It was my go to music platform, but recently I feel like it's nothing more than a cash cow. Premium is required just to listen to the songs you want, and it keeps adding songs I don't like into my playlist. And if I want to have actual control over my playlist I have to pay $10.99 USD per month, and I just don't have that kind of money. The app is so good before the premium requirement feature was implemented. Please, I'm beggin, make spotify free again.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was very smooth and good in the beginning.But slowly lot's of premium features are coming.If we don't have one we'll not be able to scroll the songs,play any songs in the middle, too much ads.Like now I can't even choose what I have to listen. It's annoying actually. First I thought it will be a nice app. But actually I was wrong..Creator of this app can change the problems, then we can also change our feedbacks. Thanks for this types of annoying features!!!!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have used Spotify for years and am a premium subscriber. Lately this app has gone backwards big time. It is unstable and crashes, it used to remember what episode you were up to in a podcast list now it automatically goes to the top and you have to scroll through until you find where you were up to and it used to be when you liked an album it automatically added the songs to your library, now you have to add them all individually. Such a shame a once user friendly app has become a mess

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Songs take ages to load up, even when downloaded and especially when you have poor connection. When I'm paying for premium, I expect to have instant access to download songs as a minimum. The new enhanced shuffle toggle is poorly designed, I just want to turn shuffle on/off. Often the app just sets enhanced shuffle as default and even when I turn shuffle off it will just default back. Overall the UI and experience is poor, and I expect a better app for the money they charge.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Hardly works everytime I press like songs it doesn't play and yes I've deleted it several times and reinstall it. Also the songs doesn't load on my tv either and always says there's a issue. I can't even change the songs to my like songs or play any songs unless it's on a queue now... I pay you guys $10 a month for it to not work on either my phone or tv!!! Everything is updated and stays updated!!! Also it's impossible to contact anyone with proof of said issues.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Usually I would rate a full 5 stars, but lately I've had an extremely frustrating issue with my playlists. Songs are being shifted to random areas in a playlist when I add a new song to that playlist, I cannot switch them back because another song just gets displaced instead of restoring the original order. I've cleared my cache and everything else but still no results.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: There's so many limitations if you don't have premium. You can't even play one song you want without it playing similar songs. It can be very annoying because you searched a song to listen to THAT song, not other similar songs. The playlists also always shuffle and even play songs that you didn't add. It is nonsense that they have to make the free version so bad just because they want money.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I was so impressed to see that Spotify has audiobooks now. When I started listening to one on a road trip however, I was shocked when a popup stopped my book from playing about 70% of the way through. "Out of audiobook listening time. You can't buy more". What an absolute shame. I now have to wait almost a month for it to reset. Why have audio books if you can't even listen to a single complete book in a month? Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was an excellent app in the beginning. however, it has now degraded to a level where, non-premium users are unable to rewind or play songs in the order they want. General users are not even allowed to move the slider and play the particular part of the song they want. The frequency of advertisements have also increased . This is extremely frustrating and needs to be fixed. This app has become an ultimate waste of time. Thank you.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This was awful, the sound quality sucks and I keep getting random songs added to the Playlist. At first I was able to skip songs and search songs up as I wished, but then it suddenly kept giving me so many ads and only gives me 6 skips an hour. I can't even look up songs anymore, only with premium you can search for songs, which makes it pointless. This was dissapointing and I don't quite understand why anyone would choose to pay for Spotify. 0/10, don't waste your time.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has been ridiculous since the recent updates. It seems way too concerned with forcing an algorithm and playing music you don't like. Every time I open the app it starts playing a random track from a random artist that, often, I've never heard of. No setting to disable that. Also, "smart shuffle" is a really dumb idea and despite an overwhelmingly negative reception of this feature, there is no setting to permanently disable. The app is also just seeming very bugged and glitchy lately.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3:
been using Spotify since 2011. ive always simped for it, but lately with every update it gets worse. now i cant even listen to playlists or songs added to my queue, it just plays whatever it wants. if i hit the back button it plays the songs in the playlist like normal, but otherwise, i've turned off auto mix and smart shuffle and it still does it. cancelling premium until this is resolved ‚úåüè?
March 20
column5: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

But if you're not ad free good luck playing specific songs you want to hear after an ad. No, it plays other random songs first before you get to hear the song you picked. Also your Playlists have to be randomized to listen to if ad free. You can't pick and choose. I signed up for ads to pick what I listened to but can't get that. Going back.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Also, i don't understand why every time, i open the app afresh, it has to prompt me with a silent 'No Internet Connection' before correcting itself r-after

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I don't want Spotify to use mobile data so I deactivated that in the Samsung settings but without internet connection Spotify doesn't load any of the offline music....

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

The UI is extremely cluttered and it makes annoying assumptions about what it thinks you want instead of just doing what you tell it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

I really like the option to differentiate between music and podcasts because if it were altogether, it'd be a nightmare. I was using tidal and Google podcast. Since Google podcast is moving to the garbage platform that is YouTube music, I've come back to Spotify as it provides both.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Corportate greed is at an all time high it seems.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I loved Spotify at first. But it started irritating me where the premium adds started to come. 1. I can't move the song forward or Backward. 2. I can't play songs on order in my playlist. 3. I can't even sometimes see the lyrics of the song. 4. You get adds twice a song. All over to say.. I should have given this app a 1star. But I still don't hate it. I know they do it cuz they want money. But you can't take our choice of songs. Pls lower the disadvantages of non - premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify used to be SO much better, but ever they added this update, my overall view on it has lowered severely. Now when I decide to create a playlist and Listen to it, It only gives me 1 song from the actual playlist before bombarding me with a bunch of songs not even in my playlist! And when I try skip all the songs to get back to my listening. The infamous "You have skipped too many times" message pops up. Forcing Me to listen to songs I don't even want to listen to! Wouldn't recommend this!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify Pro User here. I like the wide selection Spotify offers. You can also download songs to your device and add them to playlists if it's not available. However, something that is VERY annoying is the shuffle feature. I dont want an algorithm choosing what songs it thinks I want next; i want either truly random picks or a psuedo-random selection that tries to play each song in even distribution. My 1000 Liked Songs playlist sounds like I only have 40 songs in there!!!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: been using spotify for years, and i love it a lot. music is a part of my life and im grateful to have spotify. one small hiccup that i sincerely hope gets fixed. whenever i shuffle an artist, itll only play a select few songs on different devices, e.g. on my phone, it only plays a few and not the entire discography, while on the computer it plays it all. a bit annoying especially when im at work and i want to listen to my favorite artist, please fix this and ill gladly change to five stars.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify for years and I would always advocate for it but recently since the update the radios for songs/artists/albums have all had the same songs that I listen to. I try to find new music but it's really hard to do so now cuz spotify started personalizing radios which I am not a fan of. I go to a song radio to find new songs similar to that one not listen to songs that are already on my playlist. I like spotify but I am not a fan of the update. I really hope they change it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is great in overall, but you really need premium for an actuall good experience. Before, we have shuffle, and loop on playlists, now we only have smart shuffle which by the description, doesn't match at all. Smart shuffle plays music that's not only in the playlist but outside the playlist. Don't get me wrong, I love this app for listening to music. But I prefer youtube music for a better experience without to pay anything. Also please stop advertising horror podcasts please

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify ruined music for me. Music is meant to be shared. After having other people play music on my phone in a car trip my listening experience has been horrible. I put on a metal playlist - app plays pop after one song, rather than continue from the playlist. WHATS THE POINT OF A PLAYLIST IF YOU DON'T FOLLOW IT!? What's even worse is there is no customer service to call. This is like breaking up over text. I can't recommend this as a paid service and have cancelled my subscription.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: At first I gave this app a 5, but lately on my android phone and my laptop the music plays 3-4 songs and just stops. No ads, it just stops. I have to restart the app to hear a few more songs before it stops again. So üëéright now until the app is fixed. Yo creaters...fix the problem please. After deleting the app from all devices AND logging out. Then reinstalling and logging back in, it seems to be working now. For how long, hard to say.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have the glitchiest version apparently. If I search for a song and try to listen to it, it plays a similar song but WILL NOT play the one I want. The ad breaks say that you'll get 30 minutes of ad free listening after like 3 ads in a row. No... every other song, it plays 2-3 ads. When I create a Playlist, I also cannot see what songs I added. So when I added one on accident, oh well. Can't see if I already have a certain song added either.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify used to be good until we were annoyed by ads but now the entire experience is just annoying. It doesn't even let us do basic stuff with the free app like rewinding the song, shuffle, etc. I'm glad that they atleast let us play music and podcasts. Now this type of restrictions doesn't encourage me to buy the premium subscription but to switch to another music services which is made even more convenient by some extension which transfer my playlists. Good job Spotifyüëç

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I understand this app yet I don't. Even though I had downloaded a bunch of songs, whenever I open up playlists full of my downloaded songs it still shows me the loading screen which would stay for about 3 mins and "Try again" would pop up after. It's frustrating especially when I'm someone who would play music the whole day and this has been what I'm doing for the past year. Please fix it.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's an okay app. I do notice however when your listening to an ad that's supposed to give you 30 minutes of uninterrupted music after listening to it, it's not true one time it only played one song before going to another ad. Another time it played a little under 20 mins before going to an ad. I just don't like the lies. On top of that you upped the price of the subscription and all I have been dealing with since then is Spotify constantly crashing or not working at all.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Free version review:- Was good before for online music. But now it's only allowing me shuffle in free version. Moreover, it has become more based on ads. So you can't skip, and if you do, double ads, each for half a minute. And if need to only your favorite part of 2-3 songs, you need to listen extra 3 min of ads for your favorite 30 seconds. Finally uninstalling this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I wish we could custom arrange our playlists like we can arrange the songs inside the playlists. I wish Spotify would stick to playing the one band I search for in my playlist instead of playing a different artist after the song is over. I also wish Spotify would let you read lyrics without having to hear the song... sometimes I just wanna make sure it's the correct song without having to google search for it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Playlist curation is weird, sometimes it's my genre, but more often not. Also I don't understand why when I 'dislike' a song it "removes" it from the playlist, but the song continues to play... You'd think the software would know this song is junk and to skip to the next. But the worst part is... IT DOESN'T REMOVE IT FROM THE PLATLIST. I continually see songs showing up that I've 'disliked'

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: 1 star reasons: If I stop listening song at some part and start listening again then I can't restart the song from beginning I have to listen from the part I left it. I can't listen songs in order I want, smart shuffle is very bad. Limit has been set for skips. If I skip a song then instead of playing the song that is next in the playlist, it plays a random song from the playlist. I didn't have much problem with no. of ads before but now because of above points I would like to say too many ads.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Garbage experience. There's too many ads. After 1 song or so, ads keep appearing. And the worst part is that the ads are a minute long. Absolutely frustrating. After the new 2023 update, it's gotten far worst. This greedy company has gone too far. Too many ads, Can't play any song on repeat, can't skip more than 6 songs, can't rewind the songs or play a certain part. Spotify is abusing it's free users. Dumb app, BOYCOTT it!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: the new update is garbage. I just updated spotify this morning and now nothing works. If I'm lucky I can see what song is playing from my notifications screen but there's no controls to skip songs, shuffle songs, or play/pause. The widget doesn't appear on my lock screen anymore, which defeats the purpose of me using the app because I can't always be on my phone changing what plays through the app. I also can't use my headphone controls like I could. Whoever made this update should be fired.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Once upon a time Spotify was the best songs app but now it became a dictator. You can't play songs as per your wish the app itself play the songs in shuffle order of you select the playlist. You can't even play a song from middle of can't replay your favorite part of the song. You can't skip more than 6 songs per hour. Ads after every song and what not. You can get rid of this only if you take premium membership.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Utter pants, the mobile app barely works. They took away all the user friendly features , and replaced it with pretty videos on the home page, bravo! In the old versions, you used to be able to display all liked albums in artist order (alphabetical) then they removed it. GIVE IT F***ING back!! All I do is listen to albums, and I like to flick through the artists to find what I want to listen too, why have you removed it?!?!?!???! Please don't force me to revert my phone OS to play Spotify again

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: 1. we can't play another song in between 2. we can't navigate between the songs 3. we can't play the songs at loop nor can shuffle by our own choice 4. too many adds 5. we can't see the lyrics 6. the changed like icon is trash 7. another song starts playing even if it's not in the queue or your playlist i wish they could provide us basic facilities being a music app, i wish 0 starts was an option to rate. wonderful. CONGRATULATIONS!!!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm a person who suggested spotify to many. I loved spotify before. And now I've started to get irritated by this app. Adds are fine, but not able to repeat same song and not able to move song backwards and forward is tooooooo irritating. This feature made me see other music platforms. Very bad experience for those who love music, and nothing less than a emotional pain for those who listen songs on spotify for almost entire day.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: 2 stars because when I downloaded it was pretty good. No issues nothing actually. But now today o coudnt listen to songs because I was busy. When I went to my playlist it was all changed. I couldn't see my songs and there was just the names of the songs. When I clicked it, it just played a random part, not the full song. It's just very much annoying and irritating. It would be great if it was changed back to the way it was. This really bad. And YouTube let's you do all these for FREE.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been a Spotify Premium user years. This might soon change. Spotify support and connectivity for Chromecast is absolute hot garbage. No song is playable, and Spotify continue to skip through every song on the list, without playing any songs. Uninstalling, clearing caches, resetting phone, resetting Chromecast, resetting network. Every app but Spotify works perfectly. This has been an issue for several weeks now and there are still no solution to this problem.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Congrats!! Thanks to the option of atleast giving 1 star or u would prefer giving 0. I mean ads and all are fine but what's the case with can't play songs on loop, can't go back to a song, can't choose shuffle in the correct order, can't navigate through the songs. And above all...I can't even skip more than 6 songs per hour. Spotify mixes two polar genres and now I can't even skip. Amazing!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: THIS IS TERRIBLE! I have been using Spotify for years and love music, need my library available. Recently it will not access most of my downloads offline, even though I have a full Premium subscription. Sometimes it will not even play anything, doesn't bring up a playbox if tapping on a song. It randomly won't even connect to the internet though I have a full connection. I am fed up of not being able to access my paid-for music. I updated OS, everything. Please fix or cancelling subscription!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app was totally amazing when we were annoyed only by ads. But now we can't even listen to songs in peace. Thanks to the features you introduced which restrict us only 6 skips, we can't even listen to songs again and can't even move to our favourite part of the song. Everything here requires premium. This is really annoyed and ridiculous.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have turned off autoplay, car play, I have turned off every setting that might autoplay anything. And yet, everytime I open the app with it connected to Bluetooth, it starts playing something, sometimes not even anything I would ever listen to. So frustrating. When I switch between headphones to car stereo, it will sometimes go back to playing the last thing I was playing in the car. Even if I close the app, connecting to any Bluetooth device will make the app turn on and autoplay.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is overall very well designed and everything is well placed throughout the app but the reason I'm giving this 3 star is because of the amount of adds I'm getting for simply trying to change a song. I'll have an add, slip one song and have another add, and all the adds are so continuous. Also what is super annoying is that you can only skip a few songs in a day?? That total bs. Please fix this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: All this time I have been accustomed to the overload of ads interrupting my seamless experience, but now even the basic features like skipping to a favourite part of the song, and listening to songs in order (among others) have been removed from the free version. This is so NOT cool! Edit: Now for free version there's just 6 skips/hour and it doesn't even let me play the song I choose!? SPOTIFY WHAT THE HECK!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Since recently, the Jam session is full of bugs and the user experience is really frustrating. As a jam guest, after 10 seconds or when a new song is added to the playlist the current song restart from the top. And since the guest is not sync with the host the song stops way before the end. Edit : It recently improved, but there are still some cuts when adding a new song

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall, the app was pretty good. I do have a lot of grievances over how the last few updates have been along with the ads. The ads are too many, too frequent, and too long. There are rarely the "watch this ad get 30 minutes without ads" ads, so every 3 or so songs you sit through 2 minutes of ads. The next issue I have is with the playlists. I can no longer like songs from the playlist, I have to actively be playing them to like them, not to mention the lists being updated while being played.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I would rate the app much higher except for a glaring problem. I like to listen to music as I try to fall asleep. Spotify has many great options to choose from but as I try to fall asleep the adds wake me up because they are played at least at 5 times the volume as the content. AN OBVIOUSE TACTIC TO TRY GET YOU TO PAY FOR PREMIUM! A SHAMEFUL BUSINESS PRACTICE!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The support staff for this app keeps non-sense making changes. The latest round makes the app friendly for 6 year olds, but wastes every adults time in navigating to desired content. They are forcing one album/Playlist to take up the entire real estate of your phone on the home screen. So you have to spend more than 30 seconds scrolling down to find what you're looking for. I've had a premium family plan for several years, but now I'm thinking of canceling and switching to another service.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: First off it's design is a poor one overall, now understand I was born in the late 1900s but when I listen to a podcast to see if I like it, I should have the option to delete it from my home page to keep it from automatically playing, that is so annoying, there's several things like that in the app. Second don't pay for premium expecting to be able to listen to audiobooks it doesn't give you enough time to finish a single book a month. Spotify has potential to be the best but it needs work imo.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't usually write reviews for apps, but I rated this down from 5 to 3 because when I go to the lyrics of some specific songs, it just says "Couldn't load the lyrics for this song". It really bothers me and I deleted the app and reinstalled it again to see if it would fix, but it didn't work. There is a whole bunch of songs that I can't see the lyrics of since months ago, please fix it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Every time i wanna play a song in my playlist now it just plays some random part of the song for 20 seconds and then turns off. It was fine before then they ruined it like they always do. I cant even play my playlist anymore in the normal order, by just clicking a song and it plays start to finish and then the next one down starts playing, BUT NO, i have to rely on the random shuffle to play the song i want. WHY DO THEY HAVE TO RUIN ANY GOOD THING ABOUT THE APP!? IT WAS GREAT BEFORE. WAY TO GO!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: DON'T BUY PREMIUM. This app is an absolute nightmare to use if you don't have a constant internet connection. You can't stream your downloaded music cause it refuses to work unless you turn on your data or wifi. Would give 0 stars if i could. UPDATE: ALMOST HALF A YEAR LATER AND IT'S STILL NOT FIXED Update 2: if you connect via bluetooth to anything, spotify doesn't recommend songs, it just plays the same playlist over and over every time. A quick google search proves this. Premium is useless

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly the more I use the new plus button the more I hate it. The functionality is not anywhere near better for to use case. Please give me the option to choose I realized this interface is not ideal when I imported playlists from another service. It creates a playlist and it is impossible to tell if the songs are "liked" unless I play them, and then click the already checked button. So many steps for what used to be so simple brain dead design

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Another poorly made app by developers who refuse to listen to users. It's BROKEN! It cannot handle losing internet connection - it won't just play the downloaded songs, it just tells you it's in offline mode. You can't dismiss anything from the home screen, so you can be stuck with icons for podcasts you don't listen to or songs you don't like. What a pathetic failure of an app. I'm a premium user and I'm done with Spotify! Moving over to Amazon Music for sure

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Decent app for music when it works. Since the last update my sound has been randomly cutting out. I have tried the usual turn it off and on again as well as uninstalling and reinstalling but the error persists hopefully it gets fixed soon as it's highly annoying when you're busy with music in the background and it happens other than that issue I'd give it 5 stars but it's slowly becoming unusable

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Why can't i alter audio and video quality anymore!!! This app is getting so bad!! Getting sick of it changing to internal storage when I always pick external. How many times do I have to delete the cache then the app to have to reinstall for it to only work for a day or so. Been like it for nearly a year. I have to delete reinstall and then download 30gb of music again. Constantly telling me its offline.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: keeps playing suggested songs while im listening to playlists, if i wanted suggested songs I wouldn't put together playlists. Plus the songs have nothing to do with the playlist. Keeps playing 4+ ads at a time. When I'm trying to find a song and click play on it it never plays the song, instead it plays a song by the same artist. On computer it's fine but mobile is horrible

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify for a number of years has had this bug with trying to scrub/search on playback. If you end up tapping parts of the playback bar in too fast succession, the playback bar becomes unresponsive - moving the slider does not correlate to where the song is actively playing. Only an app restart will fix this. It's not app breaking, but it's kind of annoying when quickly trying to go to a very specific section of the song/podcast. I noticed this years ago on my S10+, and still on my S23 Ultra.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I understand that this is a bussiness,and that you need compensation for the services you provide.It was dissapointing when I couldn't shuffle or rewind and only random would play...but,BUT I still used it,only because my fav artists and songs were all together in one place and it still played the song when I clicked on it. But this is the limit,now it won't play the song I want at all,its all random. It's like "Shut up and hear what i want you to,peasant.",and I hate this.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It is a convenient app since it has a huge selection of music and podcast. However, if you really care about music, you just gotta hate the way Spotify is compressing the files, taking away every single detail you would hear on vinyl. Truly awful. But I guess the main target group doesn't care about these things.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: honestly speaking, it's alright. I do have to take up a complaint with the new updates, especially the liking and adding to the playlist being combined. It's really inconvenient and difficult to use, and I truly believe that having the two separated as before is best (please give the heart back, the plus ruins the designs.) I think most of the changes have been for the worse recently.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: 2/10/24 UPDATE! I'm still experiencing the random shuffling of custom playlist everyday. I have premium. 4/27/23 Update! Still hanging on and doing fine EXCEPT THIS ONE THING! About once every two weeks or so, my custom playlists will get stuck on shuffle. The only way to get them unstuck is to log out, uninstall, reinstall and log back in. It's quite annoying. It would be a lot easier if we had the option to stop shuffle for podcasts like we have with music and music playlists.!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: App is really buggy lately, I just think it's too bloated and doesn't have enough testers. Constant connection issues, even when my wifi or data connection is strong and other apps can connect. Playlists and queue skip all over the place. I just think Spotify is so ubiquitous now they stopped caring, since they figure folks will keep using it. But they really need more UX testers, the poor quality control is very noticeable.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Why are you removing good features?!! You've replaced the heart icon on the now playing screen but a + button to add to seperate playlist. Every change you make is not for the benefit of the end user. You keep making what was once a great app more convoluted and inconvenient to use. Edit 15/01/24: SMART SHUFFLE IS AWFUL, BIN IT!!! Subscription price increases, a smart shuffle feature that you are no longer able to disable which actively slows down the app. Truly awful.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I remember trying SPOTIFY and really disliking the experience years ago. Didn't understand why others would want to use it. Then they had a great special so I gave membership a try. I absolutely loved it! I had to stop membership. When I use it now I'm SEVERELY FRUSTRATED. Within 3 minutes, I heard "enjoy the next 30 minutes of uninterrupted music" THREE TIMES! I didn't even get 30 seconds. I'd search for a song and press play and totally different songs would play! Argh! Hate it again! üò†

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Introduced/reintroduced ads between songs Feb 2024, was pleasantly surprised to not have unrelevant advertisments shoved in my ears between every couple songs upon downloading the app, and not having premium, but all of a sudden this has changed... Spotify is now literally the worst user experience, imagineable, for an audio streaming app. Literally no reason to choose this over Apple/Amazon music again, ill sign up for the free premium offer, then never use Spotify again on expiry, cheers.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The ads definitely stand out from the content playing. I'll have a very soft "sleeping" playlist, then some ad for a FastFood joint will BLAST annoying commercial, that has ZERO interest to me, EVER. I don't use fast food joints. And it is completely irrelevant to my music choices. It doesn't match the 'vibe' and is absolutely atrocious. There should be an algorithm that matches the playlist with the ADs. Furthermore, there should be a levelling for the volume of the playlists that match the ADs

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Usually I give Spotify 5 stars since I use this app a lot... but now I'm dropping it a bit since I'm not a fan of how buggy it's becoming a little. I'm having this issue where you arrange songs and somehow, a different song gets put on top of the list when I never even touched it. I'm not sure if it's just me, but this is actually annoying and I was freaking out thinking someone is messing with my account. Any advice or suggestions would help please... and thank you.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is a completely dysfunctional, hard to use and limited app when you don't have premium. Not being able to see the next song, having limited skips, not seeing all lyrics etc. Are just a HANDFUL of problems. At this point the Spotify app is almost unusable unless you pay for an (expensive) subscription. The worst part is the app is only getting worse year by year. At this point, who's going to be even using Spotify in the next few years? When the right songs don't even play?

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

You select a playlist to listen to and it'll play songs for a completely different playlist completely defeating the point of making a playlist in the first place. You watch the 30 sec ad and it promises you 30 min of no ads just to get an add after the first song.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It use to be good. Now the app freezes, the ai dj just repeats the same songs over and over and freezes the whole app, harder to find new artists or music then before, and Spotify playlist the same songs with mixed genres instead of the one I was looking for, and the price going up for audio books that I never even use! column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: App behaves in bizarre and unpredictable ways. Its like AI run amuck. Shuffles playlists when shuffle isnt on, plays songs not even in the playlist, and will play non-downloaded songs when not on wifi, even though that feature is turned off. The chat support function is supremely frustrating and impossible to find...why is it not built into the app? If Spotify's response here is to contact them directly...sure, but how about you make it easy to do so first? Its like you dont really want us to.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Changed to 1 star because of the following : App doesn't register the change in shuffle options. I turn off shuffle yet it still shuffles music. Sometimes when a song finishes, instead of playing the next song on the list, it just stops playing music completely. Happens more often than I can deal with without getting annoyed.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to work fine until November 2023. I'm a premium subscriber, and I music will just stop playing, and when I push play, the song starts from the beginning and not where it cut off. I've made sure the app was updated, as well as uninstalling and re-installing. column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've also been going through the same issues recently where your downloads don't work offline. I tried to find out why, and I think I may have found the issue. For people who has the same issues, i think Spotify is using the sd card as storage...and most SD cards are bad at reading. Try removing your card, to listen offline again. To Spotify team on the other hand, I hope this issue will soon be fixed.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I'm not babysitting while driving. "My Mix" on YouTube now does better than Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Burning through battery life on the Pixel 8. Device is always warm and Spotify shows as using an insane amount of battery since last charge, basically constantly running as a background process. After uninstalling my phone cooled to an expected temperature. I'll reinstall and limit background battery usage, but fix this issue. Any account-based services are running server-side presumably, so what could actually be running in the background on the device to use so much power?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Alternatively I could listen without shuffling but that plays songs in the order the playlist was created or liked songs were added. The daily playlists are typically the same songs and often taken from my liked songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify's approach to charging for every basic function is extremely disappointing. Not only are users bombarded with ads unless they pay up, but even basic features like looping songs or fast-forwarding/backwarding are behind a paywall. It's frustrating to feel nickel-and-dimed for every little convenience. Considering the plethora of other streaming options available, Spotify's restrictive and monetized approach leaves much to be desired.
