column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's annoying. Cannot play anything properly.Please don't buy the premium for Spotify. It's not worth it. I've been a member since 4 years and it has gotten worse every year i think. Even basic things are a drag and isolating the problem takes a 4 year engineering degree and it's still a mistery. Using it on Pixel 7 and before that pixel 4a and before that Mi A1. I hope spotify can fix this and bring hi-fi audio.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I used Spotify for the past five years and the ads I got back then were minimal. Now, after playing 2 or 3 songs I get at least two 30 second long ads. The purpose of the app, which is listening to music, has been defeated. The previous play button and slider have also been made premium. All this was bearable until they made choosing songs to play of my own choice from my own Playlists under premium access. I will search for some better music app which will not bombard me with premium requests.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I put a lot of time and effort to perfect the orders of my playlists especially my sleeping one I depend so much on without it I can't sleep but this new shuffle future is rearranging my playlist without switching it back I hate it so much. I was about to go to sleep just to see my sleeping playlist now out of order I spent an hour crying from frustration making a new playlist to sleep thanks a lot Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: With all the new updates in the app, we can't replay songs, can't change songs more than a fixed number of times a day, etc. For the worst part, we can't even listen to songs in the order we set out playlists or on normal shuffle. They've introduced 'smart shuffle' because of which even other songs 'that may be related' to the playlist, play along with your songs.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I appreciate the app in general. It is kinda cool to bring the libraries on trips. I really do hate when it wants 100% to control the phone. On an update, it likes to move where the files are stored. Still after a few years. Every update causes me more grief, BUT now that I know it's coming, I unfortunately adjust to it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love this app, which helps me find good music. The functionality is often altered with upgrades, which can be frustrating. This is especially true when it interferes with being able to edit my own play lists. They did seem to work out a few of the bugs following a recent update, so hopefully this is a sign of progress.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I give it 3 stars only because it has been my longest running music streaming app. It however has a lot of downfalls choosing to remain mediocre throughout the years. No high fidelity music, songs going in and out as per their whim ( I have seen many artists being disabled due to my region, come back and then disabled again) make up your mind. And now, recent updates have caused Spotify to not work with Android Auto. Unfortunately, my app of choice is shifting to Tidal with playlists migrated.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall I love the app and service it provides, but since getting android model (S21+), I now have to choose between storing my downloaded songs (~6000 songs, ~50-gB) on my sd card or being able to restart or turn off my phone. Apparently with the new android os, spotify can't recognize the SD card quickly enough after rebooting and just immediately starts redownloading everything to internal storage, which can take hours with the size of my library. This issue has been known about for years.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

That is not my preferred language. In a globalised world where lots of people moved around, this is quite strange limitation.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I use my phone number as my login and now it says "check your number" and try with other number, I've reinstalled again but no difference. It's sad to see Spotify going bad like this.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Songs don't stay hidden across playlists.

I want to listen to MY music, not whatever you consider good. the only reason i havent switched to another app yet is because there are few alternatives.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

It's definitely not the Internet, it's fast and other services (e.g. Youtube) work perfectly. UPDATE: And now device synchronization doesn't work. Now on all my devices the music plays independently, the devices do not see each other, and I cannot, for example, from my phone, change the song that is playing on my laptop. The app keeps getting worse and worse, disappointing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I have paid for premium in the past to access offline Playlists while traveling. Otherwise, I didn't mind the occasional ad on my curated playlists. However, they keep moving free features to the Premium pay wall, and now the free version is an ad-ridden shell of what it used to be. Pass.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is the only app I have on my phone to listen music but the recent update is the WORST. can't select songs can't play certain parts of a song.no play in order and shuffle dyam you are so greedy that basic things are now up for premium. your shuffle algorithm sucks omg I get 4-5 songs on repeat everytime when I play.no control whatsoever totally useless.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

If you try clicking on a song, it sends you to a random other one, and if you try listening to a playlist, half of the songs played won't even be in there, it keeps playing random ones. There is no way of disabling this unless you have premium. It's so extremely annoying. Get it if you don't care what songs get played.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

Overall, this is a decent app, just a lot of ads and odd things.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

There's not even a proper shuffle of your playlist, other songs just pop up outside from your playlist.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

I can only skip 6 times per hour. The app is updated. Also, I don't see where my queue is. I also can't shuffle or repeat songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Latest app (Jan 2024) is a huge downgrade in experience. They removed the Heart button to mark a song as a favorite. It is only be a playlist called Liked Songs now. You can add a song to that playlist, but it's more clicks if it's in another album/playlist in your Library (not ideal if driving), and more importantly, I can't have/see favorite songs within a playlist, or otherwise see songs that I've marked as a favorite on my various playlists. So the whole concept of "favorite songs" is gone.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: As someone who has played spotify for a little bit for over 5 years now, I can say that it's the best free music streaming in the world. However, everytime u finished a song or two, it gives a two 30 second ads that I personally don't mind, it clearly still needs improvements. But, the fact that they started doing video advertisements on a music streaming app kind of makes me confused and mad. I'm giving this a 4 star because of this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I pay every month for this app to not be able to fully play a song without closing by itself. is disappointing, and it feels like a scam. honestly, I would give it no starts, but it can be done. it SUCKS!!!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was an excellent music platform before. But now it is nothing but a horrible app. You can no longer select the song you want to play. The queue system has been removed which is absolutely disgusting. The songs suddenly pauses and then I have to start the song again and I can't select the part where I wanted it to be. For the users sake, improve this disgusting problems. The problems are crossing the limits now. Hope next update will do something good ..

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app was good till the latest update. Now I can't play the songs i want on repeat or in sequence. Random songs play due to the "magic shuffle" feature. This all seems to be a ploy to get people to buy the Premium subscription model. Well, no thank you. Amazon Music is way better now! Plus there's always YouTube. Your greed for money is going to lead to your downfall Spotify!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Won't load spotify when I open the app. Blank screen . Tells me to add songs to playlist that show up blank but ive added songs.Keeping having to restart my phone to get it to work. Updated app yesterday. Bugger all improvement. 3 or 4 days of this. No reply from your twitter . Also can't use the shuffle on a playlist because there isn't an option to turn you shoving your song choice. I'm not paying to listen to your suggestions. Real shame

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Absolutely atrocious, I've paid for a second person on my account, every time I try to add them there is an error. It's been 2 days, we are on a ski trip, and we can't both listen to music. This is after a year of headaches with Spotify. They are too busy finding ways to make sure people don't share accounts to worry about the service they provide. Thanks for the response Spotify. I did try to find a way to contact you before my review, but even your directions show how it's not straightforward

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've seen other people's reviews and it seems like yhey're having the same issue as me. Lets say I want to create a playlist... I can create one but adding songs to it is a nightmare. Now, apart from that, let's say I already have a pre-filled playlist with all my wanted songs there. When I press the totally 100% working 'Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è' button, it plays A RANDOM SONG THAT ISN'T IN THE PLAYLIST... Devs need to fix this mobile app issue - it's just too mad annoying.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify for Android seems to get worse every update, even for premium users. Most popular filter for podcast episodes are gone, if you search for a song to like but not play it's challenging to do, and whenever I try to go back to whatever I was listening to last time I opened the app, it chooses a completely different song ot episode. And if it does play from the right podcast episode, it starts from a part I have already listened to. Makes me never want up update again bc it just gets worse.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Can't get rid of notifnotification bar when in full screen mode. Now I can't watch long podcasts as the notification bar will birn onto my screen. I went through the help and spent 2 hours following their commands and nothing changed. Said they told me that they would email me because they got fed up of trying. That was a week ago I still haven't had that email. How rude

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify connect message is too intrusive. It should have the same behavior as iOS where it pops up only once during app session. On Android it pops up constantly, launch the app, get a message, pause a song and re-enter the app, another message. It is far too frequent and really unnecessary, I know I have other devices I can connect to. I don't need to be told dozens of times throughout the day, it's and awful UI aspect of this otherwise great app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app was pretty superb and was my favourite music streaming app. The problem arises when even basic features restricted in Basic Mode. Additionally, sometimes music stops playing in between, I don't know why. Sometimes, music starts playing out of nowhere when connected to headphones or earphones. These all are acceptable, but the main issue is song recommendation, its has became so bad, literally it has degraded so much in past 4 months.I am a student and ready to pay Rs300-350 for 1 yr plan

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It's not really just a "problem" anymore now. It's a massive one. Lately for me and my family Spotify has been bugging the hell out then after, all of our downloaded playlists are gone. I'm a creator for playlists and it annoys me so much when I got to re-download them all over and over again Do get this fixed soon so it can stop, it would be deeply appreciated.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's good except for two things- the 30 minute and free time after viewing a particular and isn't always 30 minutes and the app stops working sometimes when I have set a sleep timer on any podcast. Edit- now they don't even let you select the songs you want to play, it plays on shuffle, you can't access the lyrics or move on to a particular part of the song until you buy premium.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Almost everything about the app is great or meets expectations. I greatly dislike the change from the heart symbol to the plus symbol for "Liked songs". The other made so much more sense and now it's easy to confuse "liking" and "add to playlist" cause they're both plus symbols üòí. An improvement I'd like to see in the future is better control over organizing the library.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I use this app a lot, and I mean A LOT. I'm updating my review from 5 to 3 stars because one thing. I don't mind the ads (wich are a lot...) but recently I've noticed that in a lot of songs appears a message that says "couldn't load the lyrics of this song". I have a good Internet connection and it really bums me not being able to see the lyrics of a lot of songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Driving mode is dangerous! No matter what you click, the app randomly does one of the following: Play a random episode from a podcast (starting at a random time), pause, or skip to the next episode. No button does what its supposed to. Its impossible to select episodes or even pause (the pause button also does one of the random actions listed previously). Outside of driving mode the app functions normally. UPDATE: Tried to contact Spotify support as requested, only AI support is available.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Missing obvious features. You can't normalize the sound output, so that all songs are equal volume, or to limit loud sections blasting your ears after you turn it up for quiet sections. You also have to manually mark songs and playlists for offline listening; It should be pretty straightforward to auto-download playlists I've saved to my library, and remove the least recently listened ones when running out of room.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was my go to app for listening to songs, I didn't mind waiting through the ads for a minute or two often, but recently the removal of QUEUE feature has been a major letdown. I can no longer arrange the songs according to my mood- which is indeed a MAJOR letdown since that's what we listen to songs for. I really hope the developer and the team bring back the feature. It's no surprise how quickly Spotify is losing its popularity and ratings. A major disappointment from my comfort app

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It used to be great music app but now it's all about money ü§ë they are literally forcing users to opt for premium. Now you can't even choose the song you want to listen and can't skip songs. It only give few chances and stop . And to use this features you have to opt for premium account. Now I am so done with it that I am installing this useless app üòå

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: So... for those who don't have Spotify premium... it really sucks. You will get ads every 2-3 songs. It is an ad streaming service. However!! With premium it is the best music streaming app. It has personalized Playlist and the recommendations are almost always on point. It is easy to use and the quality is great. Invest in premium it is worth it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The new update is the definition of corporate greed. I get introducing brand new features that are paid-only, but to make 99% of the features *already available* paid-only? ü§° Wow, atp the app is not free at all. Can't even select tracks on my own playlist, can't skip, can't select shuffle modes. And the ads! It's basically an app for listening to ads now with a couple of minutes of music in between once in a while. What a joke!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Now let me preempt the response from a moderator. No, these aren't ads in the podcast, Spotify adds them before and after podcasts even when you pay for premium. If you pay for no ads there should be no ads, plain and simple. No matter where, or for what, if you say no ads then there shouldn't be *Any* ads. Don't get Spotify, find something else or better yet just pirate because at least they are truthful about what they give you.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Currently has a major bug that makes playing it in the background impossible. I've installed and reinstalled, I've cleared cache, I've restarted my device twice, I've been to the community forum. This seems like a major bug users on many different devices are having, the app just crashes constantly. I just have to hope the team knows about this issue and is working on it but I can't find anyone Spotify talking about it anywhere. It's happening to paying and free version users. Really need a fix!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You guys are normally awesome so I feel slightly guilty leaving a 1 star review but I wanted your attention!! The new layout for podcasts SUCKS. Change it back plz. It used to make sense. Now it's like drive thru menus. All pictures, less info. Very frustrating. Some of us listen to more than 3 podcasts a week. We aren't children, we don't need bigger and more colorful pictures. This is an AUDIO platform! I much prefer ease of access to the sea of information!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

It keeps stopping or restarting what I am listening to! Very, VERY frustrating! While I am writing this, it stopped again. Tried on different phones with different earphones and the problem persists, so it is obviously caused by the app. Terrible experience!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Horrible experience with this app lately. A few months ago, I wouldn't have even thought about giving it a one star, but here we are. Let's go through some of the reasons: 1) All these guys want is for their customers to buy premium 2) I was fine with the ads and not being able to download songs, but they have made some changes which I HATE. 2.a) No rewind 2.b) No choosing songs from the playlist 2.c) Songs playing from OUTSIDE THE PLAYLIST I ran out of characters, but overall, this is trash

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I dont even have a choice in the music, it just does what it wants whenever I change it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I had it at 5 stars, but every time I wouldn't be able to play a podcast, I would lower it by one star every time. I try signing out, and then it won't let me sign back in. Still one star for now at least.

For the most part I don't exactly want to have to pay to listen to the songs I like. Yes, Spotify has a better experience with premium. I just don't want to get premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Now, the Joe Rogan Experience (I never have or will be a fan) is being suggested to me at the top of my screen above my own "Recently Played." There's no way to remove that suggestion as of now. You'll be hearing from me, Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Something obviously needs fixed and I'm getting tired of mentioning it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Spotify constantly shoves their recommendations into the queues, and rarely learn better patterns, even over a year of use. Very convenient and easy tho.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I used to love and vouch for Spotify over any other music streaming service, until recently. I'm an avid playlist creator and they have removed the ability to add songs to the same playlist multiple times. This is a major detractor to my experience as a user. The new method of adding to playlists is confusing, while it's good you can select multiple playlists at the same time, you can then deselect a playlist which then presumably removes the song. This is a bizarre interaction. Roll it back.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Removing the heart feature from mobile was honestly one of the worst things Spotify coulda done. Loved the app beforehand, but now it's this annoying plus sign which makes no sense. Good music app, bad feature change. Also the ui is kind of confusing tbh.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Pretty good app, but I don't like how premium allows you to do things that youtube music lets you do. The only thing Spotify does is let you play music out of the app, but you have to buy premium to repeat songs. column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Honestly Spotify is lucky it's one of the best music streaming platforms because it's ads bloody suck. Edit: it is now the end of 2023 and the ads have gotten worse. I can barely get 2 songs before I have ads. I do like the ability to.like or dislike ads, except it doesn't really do anything either.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Radio, based on user created playlist, which is available on desktop, option is missing. Need option to completely clear queue.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Playlists will often reshuffle themselves, the "smart shuffle" function is so annoying and sometimes won't turn off, and most recently, when I use the app in the car it will automatically start playing the last playlist played even if I've already queued up a new one.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been a premium user since past 2 years. I love the app. Tho, the recent changes in the free tier, just trash. Looping, skipping etc. are just basic features on any music streaming app. You cannot monetize them, or you should have simply remove the free tier entirely, let them find a different platform. On the premium tier, the smart shuffle feature needs to be tweaked. On desktop app, its difficult to just activate the "Shuffle" feature.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify for the past 5 years and my experience with it is great. The new feature of the app is restricting shuffle play along with lyrics being unavailable for most of the songs and everything has been shifted to premium. Some of us cannot afford it. Being an old user I do not want to change apps but if this goes on I might have to.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm really disappointed with the new updates. This was a free platform to listen to our favourite songs, to reverse or to forward any songs if we want. After the new update I also couldn't able to see the lyrics anymore of most of the songs. I was using it for 5 years till today. But after the new features and updates, it has became the worst.... I suggest you to remove this and make Spotify like the previous one.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It has now turned into EA of music industry, really hate the fact that it doesn't allow basic functionality that of a music app. They are already selling ads as photos, videos and audios between songs and by locking the basic functionality makes it way to annoying to use. I understand they are here to make profits, but just going down the EA way is to dirty for a buisness. If I'm down to take ads with basic functionality just let me have it. I don't need your premium features.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The most useless music app I have ever used. If you are providing free app use with ads, it's okay. But if we are listening all the ads and choosing a song to listen, least you can do is providing it with better quality. I am facing trouble consistently with better quality listening. Each and every time the music gets disturb. It feels like I am listening to some old rolling cassette in a tape recorder and it spoils the mood a lot.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The recent change to the heart button has made using the app to discover new music significantly more difficult. You can no longer see what songs you've liked in an album or playlist. The plus icon turns into a check mark regardless of whether you've liked the song or added it to any one of your playlists. Please fully flesh out and consider new "features" before making the experience worse just for the sake of changing things. Will be exploring alternative services

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I would say this is the worst app in the play store right now. This latest version of it just ruined it. How much I loved this app before. Now I can't go back to the song i played before the current playing song. Can't put songs in a loop, like why? Can't shuffle it and the worst can't listen to a specific part in the song. I can't believe it. It lost all the features of a music app. I never felt this much done with any other app. Worst ever.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify "was once a great app". I've been using it for 4 years and I really loved it because of the UI and easy navigation through playlists and songs. But now, they're forcing people to pay for premium by cutting off basic features like playing songs on repeat, rewinding, forwarding, playing songs of a playlist in order, playing a song of my own choice. This is extremely annoying. If this goes on, I'mma switch to an alternative.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Don't like the latest updates. Heart button is missing and now adding/removing a track from the liked songs list is so much extra faff and can't be done from lock screen afaict. I would consider this a major bug, at least for me. I used this feature a lot and it's replacement isn't anywhere near as good. Unless I've misunderstood. Why they change? As a user the new behaviour seems much worse. Also seems it's not possible to reorder the current play queue on Android, nor delete duplicate tracks.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: App is kind of Mid now I've been using spotify for about 10 years now, I really like making music mixes for friends, and it has always been really good for discovering new music to add to my playlists. But I have really been having a hard time with the music playback over the past year. Spotify forgets where I last left off at, everytime I connect to a bluetooth device, it resets the playlist. I don't enjoy losing the ability to listen all the way through a longer playlists. More can be said...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This was the best music streaming app. Key word - *was*. Now everything is only available to premium users. Every feature, even u can't play the song which u want. If u play that song several times in a day, after 3-4 times you can't play it cuz everything is premium. I've been using this since 2020 but now it has become worst. I will look for an another music streaming app. @spotify if u don't want to lose your users please do everything like it was earlier.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify used to be ok, but now it's terrible. First problem I have, is it will give an ad and a message saying I'll get the next 30 minutes of music ad-free. But literally after the 1st or 2nd song, I'll get an ad. And it's not just 1 or 2 ads anymore. I've gotten up to 4 ads in between almost EVERY SONG. This used to be a great app, but now I can't listen to music without a million ads. And, a song will randomly pause for no reason. Sometimes it restarts the whole song.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This music app used to be fantastic, but now it's unbearable. The excessive ads have made it almost unusable, and removing vital features like playlist customization and library management is just a slap in the face to long-time users. It's a frustrating experience, and I'm actively looking for a better alternative that respects its users' needs and enjoyment.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Also, I'm really tired of it restarting every time I start my car. Even when I'm not using it and the app is closed.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Or a playlist management view (tick songs in/ out of multiple playlists) would be nice!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I listen to a lot of music so it happens to be worth it for me, but if you don't wanna pay, use SoundCloud or Pandora, not this.

Thats been fine, and the offline system was great and fine. However, recently, it feels like Spotify offline mode has changed, and when in offline mode, my playlists will not load at all, and frankly, it sucks. Please revert it back, and fix it.

Now I am having an amazing experience as it's giving better sound quality because of better frequency. Never thought I had to use this as a fix after 15 years.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

You can't even load the previous song neither can you loop the songs nor can you play them in order. This is straight up bs. Previously the ads were annoying, but still it could have been put up with. Didn't expect the devs to be so preposterous.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Which bothers me alot. I don't know where else to voice my concern other than here..... I never had any issues with this in the past. Only since the update. This is something that is very important to me, I would like this fixed, or else I will consider just using the free version and finding another favourite music app

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The worst ever updated. Can't skip song's. Can't play previous song, can't repeat the song, can't play whichever songwe like our playlist, can't play a particular part of the song can't loop or skip the playlist. When your try to do these premium membership . The not end, after each song 3 ads pop up . Like what the hellis the updated all about? I didn't knewthey would go to this extent for getting membership from the listener

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: "We‚Äôre always making changes and improvements to Spotify. To make sure you don‚Äôt miss a thing, just keep your Updates turned on." For you kind information 'improvement' Means making things better and not taking away features. I will never update this app ever again and i suggest the same for anyone. You can't go back to the previous song. You can't skip to a particular part if the song. The quality is unbearable, so i had to download my favorite playlist and then listen to it. Please improve

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Before the the new version this app was best for music. I always felt soothing when I listen music from sportify but now it's getting worse day by day. Please make this app as it was before . I can't tolerate the constant change of songs during playing a playlist. I want to listen the songs that are in my playlist not the recommended songs. I want the old feature back.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been a longtime user of this music app, and I'm incredibly disappointed with the recent changes. The app has disabled basic features that I've relied on for years, and to make matters worse, they're now charging for these essential functionalities. It's frustrating to see such a significant degradation in user experience and the sudden shift towards a paid model for features that used to be free. I hope the developers reconsider their approach and find a better balance between monetization

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Streams music. I pay for Spotify... here are just some of the issues I hav: (1) The MOST confusing UI. Looks good, not user friendly. (2) Song suggestions are so repetitive. It traps you in a loop of all the same music you've heard a million times. (3) Podcasts are so confusing on this app. If you listen to some music, you can't just pickup where you left off, you must search the whole show for the episode the episode you were busy with (the filters also don't work as expected). - I could go on.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: As much as I remember, Spotify was the best app for music, but after the latest update, it has gone from best to worst. Lyrics are on limited songs, can't play the part of songs we want, etc.... The music still has great quality,but there are too many adds.Spotify has been with me through my worst times. But now it's not as good as before. Please bring it back to normal, I just can't live vithout music....

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify mobile for years now, and it's been great. As of today, they changed both the "like" and "unlike" function to something far more committed. You can no longer just tap on the "heart" icon to like or unlike a song. The heart icon has been replaced by a "+", and you can't tap it again to simply un-like a song anymore: you have to go into your entire "liked" playlist, find it, and remove it. Who's the genius that designed this? Smh. I have more complaints but no space left.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Everything requires premium now even switching between songs. Spotify has made it very difficult for us to stream songs effortlessly. Please remove these new features or I don't think anyone will be using Spotify anymore because of these new and useless changes. These are very bad features and it's a very useless way of making people buy premium. It's like forcing people to buy premium even when they don't want to. If this doesn't change deleting this app will be our only option left.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Stop trying to force Smart Shuffle. It's frustrating that it keeps turning back on, and doing it randomly. It should be an option to disable. It's not making me appreciate songs I haven't heard before, it's making me appreciate the fact I can cancel my subscription. Instagram ads are doing a better job of introducing me to new music than Smart Shuffle ever has.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: For me this app was the best music listening platform for international songs, from the best music quality to the most favourable conditions...... Now, they just added a terrible update in this app, it's just verrrrryyy annoying. I can't even skip through the songs to listen to specific parts of the song, nor i can start the song from the first if i want, now it requires PREMIUM feature. It's terrible, *THEY JUST RUINED OUR MUSIC EXPERIENCE*. I request the creators to fix this sooon ...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify for over a decade, been paying for premium the majority of the time as well. Over the past year, the ability to listen to downloaded music "offline" has failed. It's the main reason I pay for premium; I live in a rural area with spotty cell service coverage & therefore would rely on my downloaded music to listen to on long drives. It's upsetting that this paid-for feature isn't working the way it should be. AND you raised the price for premium when it doesn't fully work.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall I love Spotify, the music, podcasts, the student discount, video podcast. Except for recently my podcast video hasn't been working and when I choice to have the videos go to audio only, it doesn't. So finding out what's wrong with a certain issue is difficult to find your answer. You have to go through an archive of issues that are currently happening. There's no live person to talk to and get your answer. So it takes time that sometimes I don't have. Can someone reach out or update app!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Months ago I had considered deleteing this app and my subscription because of the "upgrade" to shuffle playlist. But now I really am because they got rid of the feature to add the same song to a playlist. Even with many complaints over several months is still has not been fixed. I'm a dance teacher and reliy on this feature and others that seem to be glitching... On a related note, if anybody knows any other apps that lets me play songs in a playlist more than once I'd love to know!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Giving three starts because of a few issues I have. Around half of the tracks disappeared from the my liked songs. This is extremely frustrating. It's also an issue that even though I'm paying for a subscription, Spotify has problems loading my already downloaded music. What's the point then? I am rethinking whether or not I will continue paying.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This is one of my favorite music apps, but I feel like only being able to skip songs six times every hour is a bit ridiculous. I'm a complicated woman. One day, I like a song the next day it's the worst song ever, and it makes me want to pull my hair out when I can no longer skip the song. Also, the ads, for example I have about five minutes until I get to work (I take a bus) and I know I can still listen to atheist two more song, but the stupid ads waste at least a minuetand a half of my time:/

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've moved from Spotify to YouTube Music about a year ago, and I've mostly enjoyed the change. However, this past month, the service has been going downhill. For starters, the new method of liking songs and adding songs to playlists is HORRENDOUS. I don't know why they would change it. Please put the old one back. Secondly, with the new update, lyrics no longer display on songs that have lyrics on some occasions. I guess it's just a bug on the update.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've moved from Spotify to YouTube Music about a year ago, and I've mostly enjoyed the change. However, this past month, the service has been going downhill. For starters, the new method of liking songs and adding songs to playlists is HORRENDOUS. I don't know why they would change it. Please put the old one back. Secondly, with the new update, lyrics no longer display on songs that have lyrics on some occasions. I guess it's just a bug on the update.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I installed the app a couple of weeks ago. I really liked it until the new update. I haven't seen a lot of people discuss the update, but I don't like it. I can not pick the songs I would like without a membership or additional fees. Having to play on shuffle instead of picking/having a chosen order is incredibly annoying. I have to constantly hear the same songs instead of others from my playlist. Also, I dislike that they add their own songs to your own Playlist.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was one the my favourite and best app for songs. But this new update is just frustrating. You can't listen to the songs you want to. You can't listen to the songs in an order. And there are so many ads all the time. Pls make the next update downgrade the app so that it's better for listening to songs. Now it's like either use premium or don't use the app only.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly I used to love this app, have been a user for years and up until recently (3 or 4 months) I've had no issues. But since then it's been plagued with minor but really annoying bugs. Filters not working properly, repeating the same set of songs in the exact same order when you go to shuffle a playlist, stops playing after 1 song is selected and played, and intermittent crashing. Don't bother resetting the cahce clearing data etc won't help. Spotify needs a better QA Team, bugs slipping in

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify WAS my favourite music platform. The new update is so disappointing. I can't even rewind songs. For every 2-3 songs an ad pops out. I mean what the freak is that! It was astonishing before. Now it sucks to have Spotify. We can't even add songs to the queue. It plays songs from a random playlist. It gets worse and worse day by day. I'm warning you this app gets an Big L.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The new free version is ruining everything. I understand we all gotta earn money but do not take away basic functionality of music experience. Unable to seek. Unable to play songs in sequence. After sometimes in a day, unable to play songs of my choice. Gotta switch to YouTube Music soon. I loved Spotify experience till now but I guess everything good thing comes to an end.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Nah, the app's getting worse with every update. I really wish to get the past Spotify app back, where I could listen to an album or playlist in a sequence, playback any song, skip or repeat any part of song, read lyrics, listen to songs of my choice. The artist I follow, work hard even on the sequence of album. Not being able to listen like that is pathetic. Not everyone owns a Spotify company to afford PREMIUM.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Highly disappointed. If I want to move the song head or back, it doesn't work. It says- "want to hear a particular part of the song? Explore premium." When I click on the shuffle option in the playlist to play the songs in order, it again asks for premium. Once it also asked for premium to even play any song!! I had this problem with my earlier account too, so I deleted it, made a new one, but the problems are still there. If you're doing all this so that people take premium uninstalling is good

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the app. Premium user for 5+ years but the last month or two, the app keeps crashing when trying to play podcasts. It freezes, won't load or play, and it dominates the drop down when I'm playing music, stating whatever failed podcast I last tried listen to is playing. This is also messing with my ability to control what I'm trying to listen to and is making using Spotify a real hassle lately. Hopefully it gets patched soon.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is garbage for free users on phone. You search up a song, click on it, and out of nowhere a playlist pops up, with about 10 other songs you didn't ask for. Also, 6 skips an hour! Want to scroll through playlists that you actually requested? Buy premium! Unless you have premium, the phone experience is garbage, which is sad because on an Android tablet or iPad, the experience is really smooth and to-the-point, without chucking you into random playlists.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: ive been using this app for 3-4 years now. i have never had a problem with it. but since it updated its gone downhill. theres ads like every 1-3 songs which makes the listening experience suck. and you cant skip songs, rewind songs or go back to a specific part, or turn off shuffle without buying premium. and i cant even listen to playlists anymore, theres a new feature called "similar to your playlist", and its honestly annoying. atp the free ver is a waste.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I use Spotify a lot to listen to my favorite band, as well as easily listen to my local files, but there are a good bit of problems I really hate. For starters, I don't like how when I play an album, it plays the songs out of order and throws in random songs for no reason. And I've been experiencing a recent issue where periodically while listening to my local files, the app automatically jumps up the list to the very top without my input. This also happens when I pause and select a file.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This new version of spotify is a nightmare. You can't play the song that you want to listen to. They are basically just telling us to give them money so we can listen to the songs. We can't change from one song to another. The app has become total failure for me. Hoping they somehow restore the older version and set aside their greed for money for once.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's good, but its been better For some reason, they keep trying to change things that don't need changing. For example, replacing Enhance with Smart Shuffle (which sucks) and replacing the heart icon with a plus icon (much less intuitive). Also, and it seems like I'm not the only one having this problem, with little to no internet signal, the songs will stop randomly but say they're still playing and basically stop working, despite the songs being downloaded with Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You have to pay for everything here. To change the song, to go to a particular part of a song, can't skip, only 6 skips per hour. You can't even listen to one song in peace and the ads start. And to stop this you need to subscribe to premium. It just sucks!And if all this BS wasn't enough you can't add songs to your queue. It's going to play any song in any order of it's wish.You can't even view the lyrics. I'm dissappointed I'm switching to another app! So it's losing money instead of making it

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't mind paying a subscription to get an ad free experience, but that only applies to music in Spotify's case.. Lately I've been getting a lot of (the same) ads in podcasts. They usually appear in the middle of a conversation, disruptive and annoying! There's also no way to avoid said ads, not even with a higher subscription tier. Would recommend if you don't listen to podcasts

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: My main annoyance with Spotify is that it doesn't seem to launch without an internet signal on my phone. Would be good if you could still access previously downloaded content when you have no internet signal. Previous to the above this was my review... Good service but annoying niggles like cutting the end off tracks; no equaliser (as far as I know) among other things that should be easier to navigate to.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using this app for a long time and it used to be my favourite app but the new update us just trash. It has made spotify the worst music app ever. The new update has disabled the very basic features a music app should have like replay, rewind, shuffle etc. You can't access all this without premium. Never been so disappointed. Dear spotify management team, please restore everything back as it was otherwise you are going to lose many customers.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm disappointed with the latest update. At this point, Premium is required everything. It was so cruel to take away the freedom of skipping tracks, going back to a part in the song, as well as shuffling songs in the same playlist. There's even a limit for choosing songs a day. Seriously, I'm done with this app. I can't even play a song I want, it just plays a random one then. Very pathetic and impractical. I'm going to delete this app soon

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Stick to whatever music streaming app you previously used! Spotify has just become an ad for its premium version. Every feature is being transferred to the premium version and there are ads after every 1 or 2 songs. When I listen to the songs in my playlist, random songs start playing. I can't even skip it because apparently I can only skip 6 songs every hr forcing me to listen to songs I don't even like. I'm really disappointed in what Spotify has done and I'm sure many other people also are.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Come on!! You want to your app to have less downloads or what? This is one of the biggest streaming platform. Now that you guys have made everything premium, I can not even turn off the shuffle option anymore... Upto stopping the lyrics it was fine. But now, removing the access to shuffle option... This is too much. I was way better with only ads. Thinking of uninstalling it .

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I kind of love Spotify. I've applied several times to work there. But also, their app is kind of awful. On the free version, you can enjoy unpleasant or even offensive ads that you can't skip or report. On the paid subscription version, you can still enjoy more ads as you watch/listen a podcast. And you can enjoy fun bugs, like the ads playing without pausing the podcast, and you have to finish all 3 ads before you can pause or rewind the podcast. Spotify, I think you can do better.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app can be so frustrating. There's a lot to like: Spotify connect, automated playlists and recommendations. But every time I open the app, I have to fight to get around what Spotify wants me to do vs. what I want to do - listen to music. I don't want audio books, I don't want shows or playlists, I don't want an Instagram feed of random content. I want music. I've dismissed the same audiobook popup about 6 times now. I want music and music features. Nothing else.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: This was an amazing app. It's still great for standard stuff but the thing I love most only works part of the time. And that is frustrating. Trying to get a group session started is almost impossible and tonight it is, it will not load no matter how many times we uninstall and reinstall. The group session bugs need to be fixed. Edit 10/11/23- the new jam session isn't fully compatible yet and I can no longer listen with friends and it is extremely frustrating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I absolutely hate the new update, 6 skips?, can't skip to parts of a song?, songs can't be played without shuffle unless you have premium? what have they done? They have ruined the app completely. This app has become trash after what theyve done, it wss better before, i know they want people to upgrade to premium thats why they've taken this bold step, but it just seem like they are desperate for afew subscriptions. absolutely horrendous.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The lyrics for all of the songs have became unavailable since the last three updates. I was very satisfied with the translation being provided for songs but now no lyrics are available. Please fix this problem. Once again with the new update. So many features like literally basic features have been moved to premium. Just how many ppl are actually paying premium? This is just gonna make people change apps. I'm leaving Spotify, it literally used to be the best.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This is a good app for music, typically it has all my favorite artists on here. I only rate it 3 cause of all the adds I get. I usually am okay with the adds, but then I started to get adds in Spanish, German, French you name it. The thing is, I speak English only. So you can see why I'd get annoyed, if your gonna yap my ears off. At least let me know what your advertising to me. Also, if I get ANY Christmas adds in November. I'm not gonna be happy. Anyways, good app for music, love the layout.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: One of the best and my favorite to listen to music but after resent update its so difficult to operate. All the options almost all of them require premium service to function... Repeated loop doesn't work, previous song, shuffling, lyrics are not visible even the list of song that play next is also not there. It's so difficult to use it anymore.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The latest Spotify update is frustrating, as it lacks the ability to select specific parts of a song and a 'go back' option for the previous song. These features are sorely missed and should be considered for improvement. Hope to see improvements soon or else I'll uninstall this app! So disappointed I don't even wanna give one star üëéüèª

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Quality of music is really good, features are also good But, it's not the best music app anymore, especially after the new update. I feel like it's an utter nuisance to not let the user play their desired songs in the order they prefer. If not that, atleast let us play the current song from wherever we like. Even that isn't happening which just sucks. After literally every 3-5 songs there's an advertisement, just sucks I understand that you guys need money to run your app, but this is too much.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: So many annoying bugs for such a big and commonly used app. It keeps switching shuffle back on when I want to listen to songs in a particular order. Same with the repeat function, I switch it on and after one repeat it stops and just goes back to random shuffling. If I don't have shuffle on, after one song music just stops and I have to manually put the next song. Hope it gets fixed because it's insanely annoying.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify since it came out. I paid for premium when my days were good with the money. There is a reason why tons of users like me listen to those annoying ads because we absolutely love music, it's the only thing that make any sense when we go through good and bad times. I am sadly removing this app since it's latest update of removal of repeat and skip buttons.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been a premium user for years but have hated the last several updates. Bring back radio blends and the old like button. The DJ feature is dumb. The plus of free audiobooks is nice but cuts off after so many hours. What's the point of pushing that when there is a free option with the library. It was just nice not having to float between apps. Make this truly unlimited. Sounds like the free version is basically Pandora (yikes). Disappointed to see where this app has gone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has gone from being a promising music streaming platform to an utter disappointment. What was once a great free service has now become a shadow of its former self, buried under an avalanche of premium promotions. The free tier, which used to offer decent features, has been stripped down to the point of frustration. It's evident that Spotify's primary focus is to extract money from users by pushing their premium subscription aggressively.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's amazing as it is but it would be great to be a little more open to music/songs and artists like remixes. However, I would line if they added an option to edit the homepage since some shows that I have watched for about 2 seconds are suddenly recommended to me and are on my homepage. Please, let us be able to remove shows from the homepage!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Editing my review after 3 years: They have made it mandatory to purchase a premium subscription to skip to o your favorite part of a song, and you can't replay it while playing. These are basic features of a music app, but now you have to pay for them. So bad. Free music with ads is still tolerable and understandable, but this stunt is so cheap. This is end of era of Spotify

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The new update sucks. Like I can't skip songs, can't choose the order of the song, can't check the queue, can only play a very limited number of random songs. I was very much tolerating this app not showing the lyrics, but now it's too much. This app really dismotivated me not to invest in buying it's premium ever in future. Yes, I didn't had the premium. But the creator should understand that broke people like me who love music wouldn't buy the premium in any situation. SPOTIFY REALLY SUCKS TBH

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I can no longer just quickly like a song, I have to scroll so far to even find my liked playlist when trying to add a song, if I'm listening while doing other things and press the "add" button, it adds the songs to my most recently updated playlist, and, worst of all, the green heart is gone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Despite the annoying premium ads. I was still using this app because I enjoyed my playlists. But now the button to go back and the bar where you can jump to parts of the music have been made premium features. Those buttons are the bare minimum an app can do. If Spotify can't even provide that, I guess it's finally time to uninstall this app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I really don't know what has happened to this app, but 2019 spotify was way better than the 2023 spotify. The new algorithm needs to update itself, and just to let you all know we didn't want spotify to look 'funky' we just wanted good quality and peaceful listening. I hope this app gets fixed quickly.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have the free version because I can't afford the Premium version. It used to be great and I was able to select songs on my playlist, choose between shuffle, normal play, repeat playlist in order AND put one song on repeat. Now, I cannot even choose a song to play, but am forced to play the entire playlist on shuffle, hoping the song I actually want to hear at the moment will be played at last. ADs are okay- it is the free version and you gotta make money, but this is ridiculous.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is great. I've come to really love it, well, until I experienced a problem recently... I applied for the student premium plan, had a successful verification by SheerID, and also received an e-mail containing the receipt of my purchase. My purchase of this plan doesn't however reflect on the app, it's been over 24 hours and I still haven't gotten hold of all the benefits associated with being a premium user. I'd appreciate it if this issue can be fixed as soon as possible.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Your user interface is too smart for its own good. Being able to switch devices is really nice, but hiding them behind a picture of a speaker isn't the brightest move. The interactions with digital assistants leave a lot to be desired. Even when it's obvious we don't want Spotify involved, it switches devices, and songs -- sometimes at the same time.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Paying for a dysfunctional app is upsetting. Spotify used to be so good, but the addition of features comes at the cost of a working app. Shuffle has been malfunctioning for the past +3 months with no resolution. If you turn shuffle on in the middle of a song, your music stops playing after that song finishes. Or it will keep shuffle on when you are trying to turn it off. The volume auto adjusts itself even though I have no such feature turned on my phone or the app itself. Really disappointing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've always had a great time with this app, but after the most recent update, it's barely usable because it's so glitchy. First you removed heart (which is completely cosmetic but I did not appreciate it). now for about 45 seconds after I open the app (even if it's already open and I'm just going back into it) it's completely frozen like there's no internet even though there is. The progress bar goes entirely away and I can't do anything for almost a minute. It makes the app unusable.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Pros : A ton of good songs. Cons : It's so annoying when I click on my playlist, and some random song starts playing. Like, I want to listen to MY music, not whatever Spotify is adding for me. It would totally be 5 stars if Spotify would take out that feature, cause I don't want to pay 30 dollars a month just to listen to ONLY my music.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: When I first started using Spotify I would have given it 5 stars. But for the past year the app has been randomly crashing and glitching, often turning my phone screen completely black and freezing it, which is not ideal considering I am paying for Spotify premium. Also please stop making 'smart' shuffle the default. I just want to listen to the playlists I created, not be confused as to why random music is playing, which is why I started paying for premium in the first place!

Can't believe this. Missing the previous Spotify's update. Thank you!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I'll switch to some other music app !!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I love this app, but a problem is that I get ads every 15-30 which annoys me so much. Like why have this feature? I love to recommend when you enter Spotify and your trying to play a song, just make it were it just gives a ad and that's it. No adss will ever pop up again. Also one pig problem for me is that whenever you try to put a song you searched up, it plays another song. Like why? I want that to not even happen. After it's not bad and I enjoy this app. But it does need fixes.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently updated the app and they have changed the UI and made it far more difficult to use if you want to listen to a particular group. Unless you hand pick songs and like them, there is no way to listen to their discography without having to navigate every album. So if you want to listen to all of Metallica's music, you can't just click on them and go to a list of all their songs. It's either you scroll through the list of songs you've liked or sift through all the albums.. horrible change.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The recent update has forced me to move on to a different platform . The unavailability to play specific parts, play the songs on repeat and an ad break after every few songs is really frustrating. This was the best app for listening to music, but the update just ruined it. Spotify, please fix this issue as there's no app as good as this one...

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I LOVE Spotify. I've been using it for roughly 4-5 years now. I've been a Premium Member for around 3 years. Although for the past month some issues have occured. On the mobile app, there's been an issue: my recent added liked songs won't show up in my liked songs playlist. They won't play either, at least from my liked songs list. On the computer/web browser, they show up, and SAY I have new songs added. I've tried uninstalling, updating, etc, but nothing ends up working.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Removing the heart/like song button, repeat, replay, skip to any part of the song, the best parts of the apps are gone, and only made for premium users to enjoy, it's really heartbreaking if there was an option for giving 0 stars, I would've given it right away, it's not just me but millions like me.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Don't like the way its not clear that the new audio book section isn't all free - felt deceiving

This really interferes my listening experience, I start to get bored and hate my favorite songs because of this.

I guess we don't like songs anymore... we just add them. #bringbacktheheart

column3: Apart from the continuous ads , I was using it for the good quality of music and the UI experience it provided. But removing bare min attributes like access to each part of the song and switching between songs is just too much. Really disappointed. Don't list it in free apps anymore just put the price tag before hand.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Just so disappointed with spotify, it was one of my favourite apps. Recently, it has been just getting worse. You can't skip songs , play a specific part, choose which song is going to play next, lyrics are being taken away and what not. It's literally the basic things...I have always considered spotify one of my favourite and best app but it's not just the same anymore. If it was few things it wouldn't have mattered but it's literally about everything. Im not even angry but disappointed.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: So, this was gonna be a negative review but I see that Spotify has reset the damage. And now free users can loop, skip to different parts of songs. That's amazing! But what I hate is that you need to buy premium to download songs. That's one star off. What about the other? Recomendations are always so bad. I like listening to pop songs and hip-hop. But never have I ever seen any of those on my recommendations. That's another star off. Hope Spotify fixes this and reads this

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The latest update is all about literally pushing one to take up their premium plans. We can't play a specific song , we can't rewind or forward a part of a song. We just shuffle and listen to what Spotify wants us to hear. Isn't a music app and the experience it provides about enhancing the listener's preference? Well, not with this app anymore.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The app keeps getting worse and worse. Who's idea was it to get rid of the like button? Dumbest thing I've ever seen. Since the last update I've been having a consistent problem with Spotify telling me there's no internet connection when there definitely is. Also, love the concept of the daily drive mix but for the love of all that is holy will you please fix the algorithm?? It plays seriously the same songs Every. Single. Day.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Like someone else previously mentioned, my app keeps crashing, disconnecting and I have to keep going back in to start listening to what I was listening to again. Just listening to a podcast atm, and I've already had to restart it 5 times in the last 20 min because it's randomly stopping. This is much higher than normal but it's everytime I use it.l, it stops and crashes. It's not a connection issue as I have a great signal atm. I'm was thinking it was just me but this must be an known issue?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: "you're out of audiobook listening time" ¬£9.99 for 10 hours listening time. I will admit that I didn't read the fine print when Spotify told me audiobooks were now included. As an audible subscriber I thought "that's excellent from Spotify". Turns out it very much isn't. Not impressed at all. Oh and you can't easily navigate to the previous chapters by seeking back in time. Each chapter is treated as a standalone track with individual progress rather that a contiguous listen.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: UPDATE: After an extended period of time, trying to fix the issue, I have cut my losses and canceled Spotify. App just stops playing. There is no reason that I can find. Also, I can't get it going again. After a long frustration of trying everything, I might get it going, and it stops again. There are no app updates, I have checked all the settings, rebooted, etc.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Collaboration isn't working. Full stop. I've tried a ton of different Add Collaborators option, I've shared via Instagram and Discord, I've generated fresh links, I've turned private on and off, I've started a fresh playlist just to try, but no one is able to add songs, even if they get to the playlist. My Spotify app is updated, and I restarted my phone. I thought it was temporary last time this happened, but I guess my account is buggy.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a really good app, it has a lot of songs, and not a lot of ads. It forces us without premium to listen to random song in your playlist that we don't want to listen too to use our skips and to get premium. On playlists I try to put a specific one and it plays a different song. Please change this. The app, I guess, is fine.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Being able to choose a particular song to play is the bare minimum for a music streaming app. The latest update is a joke, the free version is basically an FM radio now. It's also not that great for paying customers aka the Premium users as they keep removing songs and albums which are available in other less popular streaming apps. There's pretty much no reason for a user to choose Spotify over any other app, other than simply being used to it.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is good, but needs some work. The feature of liking songs connected to adding to a playlist make it very difficult to understand which songs you've liked and further confuses your library. You also cannot just see which songs you've liked when scrolling through a playlist. The liked song "playlist" also could use some work. There are no options to add all of your liked songs to another playlist, and you can't select the songs and add them that way. You can only do that on desktop.

Please do something Spotify üôè.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
